Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views at all times of day and night!, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Nospringchicken
Reviews.Content: e booked for a long weekend stay after reading tripadvisor reviews and thankfully booked a superior room which turned out to be on the top floor with two little balconies and the most amazing view of Paris!! The room was comfortable, a little shabby but well serviced. The hotel had left a small bottle of champagne and a fruit basket in the room as it was a special occasion and this was a lovely touch. The weather was beautiful so we drank our champagne on the little balcony overlooking the gardens, the Louve and landmarks across Paris - couldn't have been better! The bed was very comfortable and the room quiet, no noise from the road below. The bathroom was adequate, a disappointing shower curtain arrangement and a poor hairdryer but the lighting was good and there was a shaving/ make up mirror. There was a mini bar and high quality coffee and tea available. The ground floor was being renovated so we couldn't sample the bar and we had breakfast in one of the local cafes - so many to try! The hotel is so well placed to explore by foot - the metro is on the doorstep if you are off to monmatre or further afield. Theres designer shopping nearby if your wallet can stand it. To be recommended and would definately go back - fabulous weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Best View!”
Reviews.Author: Buck M
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a weekend in Paris - from start to finish excellent all round at the hotel! We got there early on Saturday morning and at 10am our room was ready, We were on the top floor and had a great room and an even more amazing view!! Would really recommend this hotel to anyone - but make sure you get a room with a view!! Staff were very helpful too!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, top location”
Reviews.Author: alberich
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel if you want to discover Paris, since it is located really close to the Louvre museum, tour Eiffel, opera house, and other attractions. A metro station is just a few minutes walk from the hotel door. The hotel itself is well decorated, the bathroom has a separate tube which is always a good plus. The room's size are ok, they are not super large, but definitly not small either. The breakfast offers good selection of food, including cheese and fruits. The staff is professional and very helpful, they promptly solved a small problem that I had in my hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Always come back”
Reviews.Author: danwallace
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in Paris. The hotel is clean, comfortable and the staff are great. This boutique hotel was recommended to me many years ago and I keep going back. Le place de concorde is two minutes walk and the hotel is right across from the Metro station. it is in a perfect location to explore Paris and is excellent value. The views from the front rooms are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding views”
Reviews.Author: lotsoflazydays
Reviews.Content: This hotel is typically parisian - it has character and is situated opposite the Louvre. The view from our window was absolutely amazing both during the day and at night. Our room was small, but no smaller than any other in Paris, nice and clean, very warm (given that it was -5 outside) and had all the normal niceties you would expect ie mini bar, safe.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelersnj_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Brighton this past August. It was my husband, me and our two daughters ages 11 and 9. Our room had a large king bed and a full size pull out sofa, a separate toilet room and large bathroom with tub and stall shower. It was such a treat to have a room that very comfortably accommodated all of us together and was so elegantly decorated. Our room overlooked the Tuileries with spectacular views of the Louvre and the Eiffel Tower. We loved watching the Eiffel Tower light show every night! The metro stops were very close and made it easy to get to everything we wanted to. We enjoyed the breakfast every morning which provided quite a variety of foods and delicious hot coffee. The staff was very helpful in recommending restaurants and even making reservations for us. They were also able to arrange for tickets on the Bateux Mouches one evening. We had no issue with noise from the busy Rue de Rivoli with the double paned french doors closed at night. All in all we felt it was an excellent value in a superb location. We hope to go back one day soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, charming room and stunning views”
Reviews.Author: flyhighstaylow
Reviews.Content: This is a small and old hotel which has luckily been kept in an traditional style. We were offered a room on 4th floor (top level) with a stunning view over Tuileres, Eiffel tower, place de la Concore and Louvre. Absolutely great location for a city weekend - close to everything a nd a metro station 200 m away. The staff was very helpful and nice, free wifi and newspapers. We did not have breakfast included, prefer to pick different places every morning when on a city trip. The room clean but a little out of date, the bathroom absolutely spotless and very clean. The shower was tricky - but that is common in Paris, difficult with both temperature and pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: vangela1965
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Brighton from the 10th -16th Dec. It was very central and we walked to Galleries Lafayette, Eiffel Tower, the Louvre & St Germain. We had 1 big room(for Paris) for my husband and I and our 2 daughters 15 & 17 stayed comfortably. We had 2 little balconies where we could see the Eiffel tower on our right and the louvre on the left. We had a lovery bakery a few doors away from the hotel called Angelias. The room (5th floor)was spacious, clean and plenty of wardroble space for all and a heating/drying rack in the bathroom. The staff at reception were very friendly and helpful with all our requests and questions. I would definitely stay again and in fact cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Shelleyanna Danikas
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Brighton , has excellent views, is situated in the heart of Paris, you can walk to many main sites to see in Paris, including the Eiffel tower. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Service was good except some areas needed additional cleaning which they were happy to promptly attend to. The hotel was quiet and clean. Wonderful experience, will go again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views!!”
Reviews.Author: al_kennedy
Reviews.Content: The Brighton was a great find! The prices were reasonable (for Paris) and the views could not be beat! Check in was fine but we did have to wait a little for our room to be ready. It was before 3:00 so to be fair that was expected. The front desk staff was very friendly and spoke excellent English. While waiting I was offered something to drink and they updated me every few minutes. I wasn't just stuck in the back and ignored. The room itself (on the top floor) was very large by Paris standards and as I mentioned had views that you only see in movies. Go out onto the balcony and look left... the Louvre... look to your right... the Eiffel Tower. Across the street is the Tuileries Garden so you have an unobstructed view of the city. The room itself was a little dated, but not shabby. I personally prefer more modern furnishings. It was clean and had everything you need. The rooms on the top floor have access to a small balcony that you can walk out on. Bathroom was also large by Paris standards and was very clean. When we checked in we were taken to our room by a porter in the elevator which was big enough for the three of us and several large suitcases. When going out we took the elevator down but apparently it was a different one. The doors opened and it was about 18 inches deep and wide enough for 3 or 4 people. If you are claustrophobic I would advise using the stairs :) The location is fantastic. You are right at a Metro station (Tuileries) and there are plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby. The hotel does not have parking so if you are planning on driving it will be expensive. There are several parking garages in the area but they are all going to cost you more than 25 Euro per day. As long as the prices stay reasonable, I'll be coming back soon!

Reviews.Title: “location view wiliness to help”
Reviews.Content: There is a general confusion regarding what to expect from hotels in central town Paris. Since I lived most of my life in S. Africa and like USA, Australia we are used to big luxury spaces I can understand all those travelers that are disappointed after coming to a historic cultured place such as Paris and they also expect to find the same high luxury standards as well. Well this is Europe, everything is smaller due to space limitations. So if you want to visit classic and historic Paris then you have a choice of staying in central Paris in close proximity to the main touristic places such a s the Louvre etc. ,but then be prepared to compromise luxury ,space and services, otherwise you can stay in the business district of Paris central. I stayed in Brighton hotel and for a 250 euros a night room a 4 star hotel (in effect a 3 star) I paid for location, view and this was the hotel with the biggest rooms and bathrooms in my opinion and this category. So let’s start with the positives: Location, to me best position in Central Paris with great views and walking distance from the gardens, main attractions since I was traveling with a 9 month old baby. View was unbelievable both from 314 and even better from the smaller deluxe room at 413 with two windows and better room to my opinion since 314 had ventilation problems in the bathroom. Rooms ,typical over 200 year old hotel ,I was happy with the deco ,space and bathrooms had all facilities ,plenty hot water ,shower and bath . I was impressed with the large space. The heated system was ok , but if you like more ,then make sure that the cleaning ladies don’t turn down the heat in your room while you are out. Regarding the old furniture well this is Paris and you are surrounded by 100 year old furniture and it is a pleasant addition to the atmosphere, so I was happy with it. People and services : A lot has been said about the French people and their ruddiness ,well I will disagree ,it is all about their culture and once you are traveling to their country you are guess in to their culture and way of life so once you have establish this it will make your holiday happier. Had said this, be advised that you will always find both professionals and nonprofessionals every were you go. General I was happy with the positive attitude of the Limited staff in the hotel, not all were up to a 4 star services but this was due to “cut costs” policy and to my surprise they did everything possible to accommodate my demands or requests. Just don’t be rude, don’t belittle them they are very proud nation. I was extremely pleased with Frederique, that went out of the way to accommodate me and my family on a short notice even if I stayed for 6 nights on Christmas and the hotel was fully booked.(she spoke French ,English and Greek ). She even booked transportation for me (all though more expensive than a taxi) as well as managed to book table at the Le joule Vern on the day before Christmas (now that was a bad choice of a restaurant but this is another story ).Her emails to my inquiries were prompted and in to the point. The reception was warm ,the luggage’s were sent to my room fast as well as collected on departure and stored safely until we were picked up to the airport. In fact a pair of earrings of my wife’s that were left in the room was given to us as well  The linen was new, clean and towels were plenty, clean, and to my surprise no dust in the room. I cannot comment on breakfast since I general prefer to eat out at my time convenience. There are two lifts a small and a bigger one that was good enough for a small hotel. There was coffee, tea, sugar, milk every day in my room all though sometimes they will forget to refill and I had to ask for it. The negative: Cleaning and hygiene is an issue in Paris hotels and I will have to say that the cleaning services need more training in order to clean better the bathrooms .I had to request three times a better cleaning service in the bathrooms and I was a bit disappointed as they sprayed aromatic spray in the bathrooms to get rid the drain odder in room 314 , that caused me allergies the last day of my stay. 314 room has a problem with drain odder and poor ventilation in the toilet that is separate from the bathroom and faces the main bedroom. 413 has a passage that has the toilet and bathroom and then the bedroom. Better choice if you ask me. No drain odder there as well and better view. This is a 3 star hotel service to my opinion but all small Paris hotel in this area are within the same categories .It has to do with location, view and exposure to central touristic position. I cannot find anything else negative to say except that in the evening there is only one person in the hotel (frond desk ) and when I had a problem with some of the plugs and lights not working I was asked to go downstairs to the reception in order to pick up globs  We all know that most problems occur when the guests are return from their daily trips and need to rest, sleep so in the course of the night there should be more capable staff. For 250 euros a night I would like complimentary water in my room, and I found prizes in the mini bar a bit expensive.(a juice 6 euros ,water 5 euros) Also I found that communication and coordination can be a problem between staff I had requested over my emails a baby cot and a baby milk warmer ,they forgotten to had them placed in my room when I arrived , however this was rectified immediately so no fuzz, and since I had arrange for 1300 check out but the front desk at the day of departure was not informed for the late chkout he was a bit “ persistent ”and I had to speak to him a bit “straight”  I didn’t find any overprizing with my bill and everything regarding prizes was according to my knowledge and expectations. Tips to save you money “ : One of the ways they make money In Paris is to sell water very expensive. A small bottle of water (250ml) is charged 5 euros so remember Paris tap water is excellent quality for European standards and buying mineral water in supermarkets will also save you some bucks!!We were surprised in local restaurant to see only tourists drinking bottled water while most France people were drinking tap water on large glass containers. I cannot understand in this financial crisis why they do not sell the water at a reasonable prize and forcing most tourists to purchase water outside of the hotels… Also stop a taxi at the road and it will be cheaper than have transportation arranged from the hotel. I believe that whatever the hotel books for you takes a cut that makes your bill more expensive. I paid 65 euros for one way transportation from the airport that was arranged from the hotel .however you can book yourself over the internet for 35 euros. Overall I will take my family there again I was happy with my stay and will recommend the Hotel to others as well.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: Chipmunk24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Brighton last fall, with my husband and teenaged daughter. We had a one-bedroom suite. It was very spacious, but otherwise a bit shabby. The furniture was very worn, the carpet was badly stained and it was very dark because we only had tiny windows that opened up to the back side of other buildings. The bathroom was new, clean and modern, though. I think we just got a bad room. I've seen other guests' photos on Trip Advisor, and honestly, our room looked nothing like that. We paid almost 600 euros per night, and I have to say I was a bit disappointed. Part of the reason we paid so much is because we were in town for a conference. The whole city was sold out, and everyone's prices were jacked up. When we tried to change rooms, there were no other ones available. So, as everyone has said, the location is great. I found the staff to be fine, and nice enough. And, I can't say the hotel is awful. Our room was dingy and worn, but apparently they aren't all like that. Just know that the quality of rooms is inconsistent, so you are taking a gamble when you book.

Reviews.Title: “Totally fine”
Reviews.Author: alexny73
Reviews.Content: While this is not the fanciest, most stylish, or most romantic hotel, it's really a great place for the price. Sure, it's still not cheap, but it's about 1/3 to 1/4 (to 1/5 in some cases) the price of the Meurice, a few doors down. The rooms show some wear and the interior design is not particularly inspired, but the location is unbeatable, the staff is great, and everything is clean and comfortable. One thing to consider is that while the rooms in the front of the hotel have the best view, they also overlook the very busy rue de Rivoli, and so do get some street noise despite double paned windows. We did not have a problem, but more sensitive people might. All in all, well worth the price for a comfortable base with ready access to all the key Paris attractions. And if you do feel like you need high style, go have a drink at the Meurice. That's what we did!

Reviews.Title: “My 50th birthday in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mom2JenandLu
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to Paris for my 50th birthday in July of this year. We had visited Paris before as chaparones to a large group of teenagers and stayed in a very sketchy 2 star hotel. This time we left the kids at home and took off by ourselves for 2 weeks of fun. The Hotel Brighton was everything I could have wished for. We had a large room on the 4th floor overlooking the Louvre and the gardens. It was perfect! very luxurious and romantic. After 5 days of staying in smaller hotels around Europe with minscue bathrooms I was prepared for yet another tiny bathroom. I was plesantly surprised that the bathroom was very large and had both a roomy shower and a deep soaking tub. We celebrated my birthday night sipping wine in bed while watching the Eiffel Tower twinkling in the background. I can't say enough good things about the hotel, the area, and the staff. I will fondly remember my 50th birthday in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, clean rooms and a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: radw51
Reviews.Content: Brighton Hotel is a fairly small hotel on the rue de Rivoli, near the Metro and about 15 minutes walk to the Champs Elysees. It has a small welcoming reception area and my room was overlooking the main road which I must admit made it a bit noisy at night, without the ability to open the window, which was a shame as the aircon was pretty much useless. The room was small and very clean, not cluttered with junk and the bathroom was spotless. I can thoroughly recommend the The Brighton for its location, cleanliness and reasonable pricing.............I also stayed the George V........at nearly 3 times the price!

Reviews.Title: “Central, ideal location, our Favourite in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AussieHA
Reviews.Content: This is our "favourite" when visiting Paris. Fronting rue de Rivoli can provide great views, but we prefer the rooms not fronting the 24h bustle - which we have found can lack any street noise. 1 block from Tulerlie (Metro 1) Station makes getting around easy. Staff are helpful & friendly, but reserved until you make the 1st move. Breakfast is very good and now there is a small fridge and jug in the room. Amazingly, returning 3y later, staff recognised us with friendly smile & welcome! Decore is very pleasant & beds really comfortable. If walking go one street back or use the gardens, then you can avoid the tourist throngs on Rivoli footpath. Beware of the "mute girls" questionaire and the ring on the footpath!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, but book deluxe”
Reviews.Author: akoral
Reviews.Content: This is a very old-fashioned, pleasant place, in a fine location on the Rue de Rivoli. The views of Paris cannot be matched by any other hotel. That's the good news. The bad news is that you must book a deluxe room in order to get those amazing views. Our room (511) overlooked the Tuileries gardens, with direct views of the Musee d'Orsay and the Tour Montparnasse. From the two balconies we could see almost everything that's illuminated in Paris except the Sacre Coeur and Opera houses) - - Notre Dame, the Louvre and Pyramide, the Orsay, St. Germain des Pres (or was that Ste. Clotilde?), the Invalides, the National Assembly, the Eiffel Tower, the Ferris Wheel and the Arc de Triomphe. Simply amazing. The room was comfortable but not really deluxe, but the price was awfully good if you're into views. No bar, no restaurant, but a nice breakfast (buffet at 19 euros, no bargain), and awkward room service from a nearby place. The staff are helpful, but there is no real concierge. I would go back in a heartbeat, but only if I could get a room with a balcony view. Others might like the very good location, even if the room was without that luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location; Pleasant and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: JohnFromNJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights at the Hotel Brighton in early November 2011. We had an Executive Room on the third floor (Room 310) . The room was very large, clean and updated with a fabulous view from the two balconies which overlooked the Jardin de Tuileries, the Seine and the Musee d'Orsay beyond it, the Louvre to the left and the Eiffel Tower to the right. The bathroom looked very recently and beautifully renovated. The only minor flaws with the room were that the carpeting and an old sofa probably should have been replaced when they updated the bathroom, but they were not in terrible shape. The staff at the hotel were all very professional, courteous, pleasant and helpful. All the staff that we interacted with spoke English very well or at least enough that it was never a problem communicating with them. They were very helpful in recommending and making reservations for us at restaurants within a short walk from the hotel. We had 3 very good meals at 3 different restaurants that the hotel staff had recommended. The breakfast at the hotel in the morning was very nice and was covenient before starting our day touring Paris. They had juices, fruits, pastries, croissants, cereal, yogurt, scrambled eggs, sausage, coffee and tea. The cost of breakfast was a bit expensive (although ours was included in the room price), but so is just about everything else in Paris. The best thing about Hotel Brighton is its location. The view is incredible. Many things you would want to visit are within a short (10-20 minute or so) walk - - Jardin de Tuileries, Notre Dame, Sainte Chapelle, Ile Saint-Louis, the Louvre, Place de Vendome, Place de la Concorde, the Latin Quarter, Musee d'Orsay. The Tuileries Metro station (on Metro line #1) is just across the street from the hotel and the Metro is very easy to use (it's very similar to the New York subway system). We took the Metro to get to the Eiffel Tower, Montmartre, Sacre Coeur, and Versailles (for Versailles, you need to switch from the Metro to the RER C line that takes you out to Versailles - about a 45 minute train ride). Our stay at the Hotel Brighton was a wonderful experience and I will definitely stay there again on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as first stay”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneLola
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my husband in 2008 and had a wonderful stay. This time around, staying with my sister and mother, we chose a triple junior suite, which was very comfortable, spacious, clean and with incredible views. The location is fantastic, easy access to everything you need to see or do in Paris. The night concierge was most welcoming, when we arrived late on Saturday, with a lot of luggage, after a tour of Europe. The day concierge was very efficient, but aloof and unwelcoming. Breakfast was included and it was very poorly managed. On the first morning, there were no clean glasses, not much variety and service was far from adequate. We had to ask, more than once, to have cups, cutlery, coffee and milk brought to our table and we eventually gave up! The staff seemed disorganized and distracted. We also woke up Sunday night at 3AM, with very loud music coming from somewhere near the building.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Views, Incredible Location, and Refurbishment!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa G
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 4 who stayed in the Hotel Brighton 2 years ago. We returned because we love the location (almost across the street from Metro Tuileries), and the ability to walk everywhere due to being in the 1st arr. We were pleasantly surprised by the refurbishments made to the hotel since our last stay! We booked an Executive Room (because it had a sofa bed for our child), and a Classic Room (on the courtyard) on the same floor (the 4th). The Executive Room had two mini balconies with an incredible panoramic view; to the left, the Louvre; straight ahead, Musee de Orsay; to the right, Eiffel Tower, Concorde, and Arch de Triomphe. At night it was just breathtaking! Both rooms had stall showers and tubs, as well as in-room safes. There are two elevators (realistically, one for luggage, one for people), so no stairs required. The service at the front desk was wonderful; our rooms were ready at 2pm when we arrived. Buffet breakfast in the front great room was included in room rate due to it being off-season, and it was again a welcome surprise. New additions we noted were eggs (hard boiled as well as scrambled), which was so welcome when you've been away for a week and have only had bread for breakfast! There is a lounge on the first floor where there is a computer so you can print your boarding passes before leaving. We went on foot (10 minute walk) to the Roissybus at the Paris Opera, which only costs 10 euro per person to get to CDG airport, which we recommend as an affordable option to a taxi if it's the right time of day and you don't have too many bags (per front desk, taxi costs around 55 euro plus 2 euro per bag). Overall, we completely enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Brighton, and if we ever have the opportunity to return to Paris, we hope to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lyan, Which is the Wardrobe”
Reviews.Author: gbf1
Reviews.Content: A lyan or lyin is a Doric Scots name for the roof that slopes into an attic room, we were in a garret over a garret, we wondered if we would have more room in the wardrobe. I found it very hard to rate this hotel, for apart from such a small room for a 4 star hotel, it was excellent and I’ve tried not to be too hard on it, also, although we’ve been with our caravan in Paris, we haven’t been to hotel there for a few years, so we’re out of date with pricing. Friendly staff, a view to die for, easy to get everywhere, good bathroom (apart from a slippery shower floor, simple bad design) with all the goodies, efficient lift, €8-10 for a taxi from Gare du Nord and plenty happening around it. The only advantage of being on floor 5 is that any city centre hotel is liable to traffic noise but we were high up enough not to be troubled and the cute swing out windows, onto a small balcony, were double glazed. The restaurant was beautiful but we thought €19 for breakfast a bit steep and also eating in the hotel can be a bit claustrophobic, so we discovered the delights of a Le Pain Quotidien. There’s some good restaurants nearby but some are rip offs, so use your Trip Advisor App or stroll/metro to the Latin Quarter or our favourite Le Sergent Recruteur behind Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with a fantastic location. Very clean room”
Reviews.Author: Hobbsy14
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Brighton at the end of October 2011 and had a wonderful experience. It was my wife's birthday and the hotel had waiting for us, in the room as we checked in, a bottle of champagne on ice and a massive fruit, all complimentary. The staff were always willing to help us, when we needed it but also, when we wanted to be left alone, they didn't hassle us. Being a well travelled couple, this is nice to see. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone heading to Paris! and I'm sure, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but tiny room”
Reviews.Author: PS_00
Reviews.Content: The location is great, you are an easy walk to the Louvre, Place de la Concorde and everywhere in between, also really easy walk to 2 metro stations, so the location is fantastic. The hotel is OK, clean and comfortable. We had a less picturesque view than some of the website photos, overlooking the courtyard in the hotel, but it was really quiet which is rare in central Paris. The room that we had was really small, but it did have a lot of storage, which helped as it was hard enough to walk around the bed without tripping over bags. We didn't spend too much time in the room though, so it was no a huge issue. We didn't really need that much from the hotel staff, but they were always very friendly and polite when we spoke to them or asked them for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: jimjasperjazz
Reviews.Content: I had visited Paris back in 1974 with our high school concert band . This incredible trip was an experience that had never left me. So when I wanted to take my wife to Paris it was very important to choose a very central hotel and close to all the important sites. After searching all the hotels I chose the Hotel Brighton because of it's location and it's long history. We weren't disapointed in the least and the hotel was in THE best location you could ever want. I want to thank all of the staff at the hotel especially the waiters and ladies who served us the most incredable breakfasts every morning. Thank You again!!!!!! We will return..... soon. William Noble , Prince Edward Island, Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely position and very nice rooms but...”
Reviews.Author: Jewellsverne
Reviews.Content: just lacking in friendly atmosphere - not unpleasant but you are just there not really a guest. The room we had was very nice with a lovely view of the Rue de Rivoli and much of Paris including Tour Eiffel - great location for Musee d'Orsay and Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mick p
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Brighton earlier this month. We had stayed there 22 years ago. It is a beautiful hotel and is upgraded from when we were there years ago. Our room overlooking the courtyard with a partial view of the Tuileries Garden was very nice. The staff was very helpful. Of course the location is great being close to everything on the right bank. We could not have been more pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Graham J
Reviews.Content: We arived in Paris on the 15th September to the Hotel Brighton. The trip was for busines but we had booked to stay over the weekend to see Paris. The Hotel was perfectly positioned to walk around the heart of Paris and explore all the sights on foot.After researching hotels on Tip advisor I settled on the Hotel Brighton and it did not dissapoint. From the moment we arived the reception staff were the most welcoming I have met. They spoke perfect english and could not do enough for us. I had read that the hotel rooms in the city could be on the small side but our room (501) was a good size with a desk and chair etc. The hotel also organised airport transfers for us which were first class. Five minutes from the Louve and oposite Jardin desTuileries it is perfect. It is an easy walk to Notre Dame along the river bank with many restaurants, for those who feel the need Carrs Irish pub is also two minutes walk away. The river taxi is superb and gives a hop on hop off service so I recommend it. A word of caution regarding pick pockets they operate openly along the arched shopping areas and main attractions. The latest scam at all the sights is also to get you to sign a petition supporting the deaf and dumb and then asking you for a donation this is a scam do not do it. Apart from that if you are looking for a quality hotel in the heart of Paris then I recommend Hotel Brighton for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: solojctravel
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel after my recent stay for a number of reasons: 1) the first room I was given was very small, dark, with little closet space, and poor layout. But even worse was the carpet. It was stained all over. It was so depressing that I asked to change rooms. In this case, the service was excellent. The gentleman at the reception desk immediately gave me the room across the floor which had a much better layout. While the carpet was still stained in this new room the light and layout were a big improvement. 2) However, during my first night the air conditioning in this second room did not work well. I turned the fan on high and within 30 minutes it automatically turned off. I know this because the heat and stuffiness woke me a few times during the night. The next day (Friday) I notified the hotel of the issue. I stayed another three nights and brought up this issue each morning and evening because the problem was not addressed. 3) Toward the end of my stay I asked the receptionist whether I needed to order a taxi to take me to the train station at 6am for a day trip I was taking. He said there was no need to do this since at that time there are plenty of taxis. Well, this want the case. The morning receptionist had to order me a cab. 4) The overall attitude of the hotel employees stinks. They are not helpful and in one case quite rude and condescending. 5) The hotel has no restaurant and only serves breakfast. It's a buffet that is not great. After I saw a guest put his hands into the bowl of dates near the cereal I decided to try other options. For around 20 euro there are many better options.

Reviews.Title: “Charming spot in touristy spot.”
Reviews.Author: Dani-on-the-go
Reviews.Content: My 7 year old son and I went to Paris for his birthday. I had asked for a nice room with a view and they sure delivered! We had the standard room and had a balcony that was on the quiet street side but looked over the tuilleries. They also surprised us with a birthday plate of fruit, mango juice and a coke! My son was in heaven! The staff were very nice and accomodating. Thank you for making our birthday trip so easy and special.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: jjfuntimes
Reviews.Content: Situated opposite the Tulleries Gardens and with Tulleries Metro across the road we were able to go everywhere by Metro or were within walking distance. The room is large by Parisian standards. We could see the Louvre and Eiffel Tower from our room. Breakfast is available on the ground floor of the Hotel or room service. Many cafes & restaurants within a couple of minutes walk. Just magic!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location! And do read about bike hire!”
Reviews.Author: SouthWestJet
Reviews.Content: Just spent four exhausting days in Paris, now broke, fit (from the MILES) one ends up walking but none the less fatter!.There are more hotels than you can shake a hat at, so personal recommendation helps. The Hotel Brighton is right on the Tuileries, almost opposite the Metro. It is quiet, clean, friendly and the beds and linen are excellent. They only do breakfast which suited us,it was E19 so we walked 50 meteres to the corner cafe and it was E8.50. This is where we hired the Velib cycles. To start with you need the patience of a saint and the help of our breakfast waiter to navigate the system. We rented for a day, we haven't had the bill yet! It was great fun and brilliant to get round UNTIL IT RAINS then all the bike stations are full and despite driving round they were all full in our area. There is an English speaking person on the end of the phone, but she insisted that we HAD to find a station to dock them into.My husband spent the next couple of hours going up and down from our hotel room in the rain to the cycle station waiting for a space to become free. He spotted a gentleman about to vacate a slot, RESULT! He almost ran dragging the bike with the wheel still padlocked (one is provided) to the slot.PHEW! With that a lady appeared and vacated anothe space HOORAY, he grabbed the second bike and almost threw the bike into a slot. YES!! Time for a drink I think!

Reviews.Title: “never to be missed”
Reviews.Author: markhenry2
Reviews.Content: For several years, whenever we travel to Paris, we do not miss our stay at this hotel. Well located, classic, clean,friendly, cosy and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Dreamy Stay and The Most Wonderful Views”
Reviews.Author: Merran97
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here after other reviews on TA and must I say what a stay for us. We did decide to splurge and booked the deluxe room as well as a Rivoli package which included champagne and macaroons - we all need a little romance in our lives!! The views of the Tuileries, Eiffel Tower and The Louvre amazing!!!! The room was stunning and the bed one of the most comfortable on record. For couples planning a honeymoon in Paris, stay here at least one night - it really is postcard Paris! The service was excellent - efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: FunTraveller36
Reviews.Content: A great location - right near the Tuileries metro station; and a very clean and well kept hotel, with friendly helpful staff. I really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but don't expect a full service hotel”
Reviews.Author: alimarie1502
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Brighton for one night - we had a party to attend outside of Paris. Obviously the location is excellent. I found the rooms mediocre- nothing special but not awful. Our real issue was the service. Our requests were fairly basic- we needed recommendations for hair and makeup and a car service to and from. The front desk staff (I will not say anyone there was a concierge) forgot our requests, didn't bother to call anyone or provide recommendations and were utterly and completely unhelpful. On top of this, housekeeping knocked on our door a total of five times in a less than 24 hour period while the Do Not Disturb sign was in the door. As frequent visitors to Paris who have stayed in maybe 8 hotels across the city, this would rank last.

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: threekidsplustwo
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a two week vacation in France. We stayed at the Brighton for three nights in Paris. We loved this hotel! Like most French hotels, it is small and older, it is, however, lovely. The location is perfect. Our room was on the 4th floor with french doors that opened up to view the Louvre and gardens directly across the street. The Eiffel Tower is to the right. Every morning we would drink our coffee watching the square come alive, every night we watched the Eiffel Tower light up. Behind the hotel, sits beautiful shops and nice restaurants. Perfect location. Very safe and quiet. The room is large and lovely. The king bed was very comfortable. The sofa bed was the most comfortable sofa bed we have slept on. The toilet is in a separate room. The bathroom has both a shower and bath. The vanity is large and the products nice - cozy robes and slippers too. Our room had a hall at the entrance with two large closets. The staff at the front desk were very kind and helpful. They always welcomed us and were quick to help with reservations and travel advice. This hotel made Paris even more magical! This is a most wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: deanna_shops
Reviews.Content: Loved the convenient location of this small hotel. Within easy walking distance to many museums, across the street from the Tuilleries, two doors down from the famous Angelina Bakery's delicious pastries and amazing hot chocolate, close to St. Honore shops and a Laduree Bakery, and more! Also, the staff were very helpful, especially the night clerk Matteo, who spoke fluent English and was sincerely nice about answering our many questions and helping with several requests. For this price range, this small hotel was great!

Reviews.Title: “Top Staff”
Reviews.Author: Santorini74
Reviews.Content: We did not have a fabulous view from our room but I did ask for a quiet room and indeed it was very quiet. This hotel is situated in the Rue de Rivoli, heart of Paris, opposite the Louvre and the Tuileries Gardens. Ideal if you like visiting monuments but also if you enjoy a walk in a park. It is furnished with antique furniture and artworks. Our room was clean and the bed very comfortable. There are plenty of restaurants (all sorts) nearby. We often have week ends in Paris and have stayed in many different hotels. What made this hotel special was its situation, being just opposite the Jardin des Tuileries was without doubt a bonus as after our busy days it was a pleasure to be able to walk through the gardens before reaching our hotel. The added bonus was without doubt the staff of the Brighton hotel, the best we have met in any parisian hotels, there were helpful, kind and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Texasstarr
Reviews.Content: This was a Hotel on Rue dr Rivoli right across from the Tuileries Gardens (connects to the Louve). The rooms were very nice and when our French Doors were closed, we could not hear a thing outside. The staff was very nice. Since I am an American, I like ice in my drinks (I think they have an ice and water shortage over there) and every afternoon when I would come back to my room, they would give me a big bucket of ice to take to my room. This was like gold to me! I had read so much about Parisians being rude, but these people were extremely nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Aaliz913
Reviews.Content: Good value and the location is excellent. But it is a small hotel, so we had some trouble getting things like ice and extra pillows. But all in all we would stay there again just for the view from our room!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: JenD1973
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Paris. Mother and daughter celebrating Mom's 60th Birthday! We stayed at the Brighton based on price and previous reviews. It's a great location, and friendly staff that was very helpful. The room was charming and spotless. This was a great location for doing all of the touristy things in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: tafab2
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our first trip to Paris. We stayed at Hotel Brighton because we saw it in the National Geographic Traveler Magazine. This hotel was great, perfect location, across from the gardens at the Louvre, walking distance to Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Arc de Triomphe, and to the train station for a trip to Versailles. The staff could not have been more polite and helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever”
Reviews.Author: korosi73
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to Paris, but actually the first one when we were completely satisfied about our hotel. I choose Hotel Brighton on the basis of comments and valuations on tripadvisor and I can tell that we were not at all disappointed. We had an executive room on the fourth floor with a breathtaking view of the Tuilleries, the Louvre and the Eiffel Tower. The room was huge, clean, well kept, cosy, with nice furniture, excellent bed (ooops!) and real "Parisien charm". Front desk was a dream, always there, always helping us, and always welcoming and smiling. When I booked the room (months before our arrival) I probably mentioned in the e-mail that it will be our 10th anniversary with my husband, because guess what, a complimentary champagne and a fruit basket was sent up by the hotel. It was so very kind and thoughtful of them. All in all, we had the best vacation ever in Paris, and this hotel will be our headquarter in Paris from now on... Thanks Hotel Brighton!

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: normgOttawa
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in to the time we checked out 6 days later, the staff could not do enough for us. We had the suite with the court yard which is the parking area but did not go to Paris to look at a court yard but to see Paris. The location was 1/2 block away from our tour company. We took 3 tours. The hotel has provided a kettle for making coffee or tea in the morning. We tried the breakfast on the last day of our stay and it is about the same price as nearby and less expensive than Angelina. We walked to the Louvre, Notre Dame, D'orsay, Eiffel Tower and the Arc. Lots of shopping and resturants nearby. Bed needs memory foam as it was hard. Internet access was great, available and free. Again a plus to the staff. With our limited french, we had no problems. More than enough space in our 2 room suite. I am glad we went to a french hotel and not a chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location helpful staff, hotel needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: Chicagogirl1971
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is a location. It is in minutes from everything - trains, tourist agencies, nice restaurants (both expensive and very reasonable). The staff was very helpful and friendly. Almost everyone spoke English. When we first moved in, the air conditioner was not working. It was fixed in 15 minutes. The staff could not be nicer. They gave us maps and explained anything we needed. Hotel room was clean and the maid service was fast and efficient. However, the hotel is old and no amount of cleaning could help it. For example, the bad spread was clean, but you can see that it was washed hundreds of times. The furniture was old, very old. There were only two English channels on TV - CNN and some other news network. The room looked nothing like it did in the picture.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous view and a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: kpatri
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded expectations. The view is stunning (Louvre, Tuileries Gardens, Musee d'Orsay, Invalides, Orangerie, Jeu de Paume, Eiffel Tower with light show every hour, Grand Palais and Arc de Tromphe all laid out before you without even leaving your room. Room with views cost more but traffic noise is cut right out by the triple glazing (the Rue de Rivoli is always busy), The absurdly expensive Hotel Meurice is almost next door with exactly the same view and less effective sound insulation (apparently). Bathroom was superb - spacious and spotless - and the bed really comfy. There was nothing not to like about the Hotel Brighton ( we did have the benefit of a really good value pre-booked deal which was way lower than the prices displayed in the room).

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: emmaedinburgh77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 children on the last night of our Paris trip as a special treat. Our room wasn't cheap but was still far cheaper than many grotty city hotels I've stayed in and this room was absolutely gorgeous - comfortable, relaxing, luxurious with a fabulous view across the Tuilleries to the Eiffel Tour. Sunrise and sunset were lovely and with the windows closed the room was very peaceful. I was worried that the staff would be a bit chilly, given that it was such a grand hotel but they were charming... I'd recommend a room at the front of this hotel as a real treat...

Reviews.Title: “If you get the chance to go to Paris, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: JBien
Reviews.Content: I had researched many places before we left for Paris, and was looking for a centrally located hotel that had comfortable accommodations, had some space to move around and was close to the metro. This hotel fit the bill. I’ll spare you the same Eiffel Tower pictures everyone feels the need to paste into their reviews, but let me just say, the view was stunning!! We booked a Superior Room (which all have a view of the Louvre and Eiffel Tower) and were given a room on the 3rd floor (room 213); we were NOT disappointed. The staff at this hotel were really professional, yet were personable enough to make you feel like you were welcome. Every one that we encountered were very nice and provided advice for things to see/do in the local area. Let me just say that the room was SO great. There was a small sitting area, the bed area, a large bathroom with a counter on which to put my girly things (pedestal sinks make it hard to get ready in the mornings because there's no place to put your things while you primp) and a closet to put away clothes. There were two large floor-to-ceiling windows that overlooked Rue de Rivoli. There were two sets of windows per opening, so there was an exterior set of windows that would block out most of the street noise, and a second interior set of windows that you could shut to block out the rest of the street noise. You could barely hear the traffic outside with both sets of windows shut. So the street noise wasn't that much of a bother. I just couldn't believe that there were utility workers at 5 AM banging away on God knows what of 2 of the mornings. But that's not the hotel's fault. If you looked out of the windows to the left, you had a great view of the Louvre. If you looked out the windows to the right, you had a phenomenal view of the Eiffel Tower. And straight ahead was the Tuilleries Garden with lots of greenery. The WiFi in the room was free and was consistent and reliable. However, the buffet breakfast was not free; it was 19Euro a person, which was really high for the small selection of food available. So we opted instead to walk (left out of the hotel) down the street 100 yards to the Welcome Cafe. We recommend you get out and about to see what cafes are in the area; you’ll find breakfast is really inexpensive. Hotel Brighton had room service available until 11:30 PM, and we ordered some salads one night. We ordered the Arugula Salad and the Buffalo Salad. Each was around 12Euro and I highly recommend them both; they were great. There was a mini bar fridge available in the room as well with a selection of wine, liquors, water and sodas. The wine was 10Euro, and the water was about 8Euro. There was also a bottle of champagne. However, if you want to save money and shop at a local store for wines and water instead (and other snacks) we recommend walking out the hotel to the left 1 block, then turn left and go up to the next street. You'll see a plethora of cafes and a small grocery store. But I must say that the fridge in the room had some space to put small items if you had leftovers from dinner, or wanted to store snacks in it. The cab ride to the hotel from the airport was 60Euro, but on the way back to the airport it was only 45Euro. The Arc de Triumph was a 15 minute walk out the hotel to the right, and Louvre was a 5 minute walk out of the hotel to the left. Notre Dame was a brisk 20 minute walk to the left, but the Eiffel Tower was easily a 1 hour walk (though we weren't necessarily hurrying either). I highly recommend the Welcome Cafe one block east of Hotel Brighton. FANTASTIC food at very reasonable prices. We had the chef's special; one was a beef stew dish in pepper sauce which my husband had, and a chicken dish in a creamy mushroom sauce that I had. Each were outstanding; the waiter did not lie. :) The Welcome Cafe had a pleasant atmosphere and a large interior in which to while away some time and people watch. The waiter was attentive and very personable as well. We felt we chose a great spot to call home-away-from-home and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone with a modest budget. The staff were all very nice and friendly as well as helpful. The entire staff spoke English but humored me when I wanted to try my French. They truly helped our first Parisian experience become a cherished vacation, and we'll definitely return to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but location and soundproof room make it worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: John660
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location for the price. Most soundproof room we stayed at in Europe, so the sleeps were pure bliss!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: romanciaobella
Reviews.Content: Paris is made even more magnificent when one stays in a great hotel. The professional staff, from the bellhop to the concierges with their on the mark recommendations, created a wonderful ambiance. The corner room was perfect for a family of four and breakfast was delicious. The views are exceptional. The Brighton Hotel is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE TOP 3 most ROMANTIC TRIPS (SO FAR!)”
Reviews.Author: maltesefan
Reviews.Content: About 5 years ago, my husband and I stayed at the Hotel Brighton for a week. It absolutely was so charming and fullfilled all my ideas of what Paris represented. The view, the location, the fixtures in the bathroom were even gorgeous. Every night we went around the corner to the most darling Irish Pub for a night cap. It was all so ROMANTIC!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Views of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Harrisuk81
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a superior room on the top floor. A bit pricey (although it is Paris, what do you expect). We had the most amazing views of the Tuilleries Gardens and the Eiffel Tower. Mega brownie points for the romantic traveller. Very central, close to metro and not too far from CDG Airport.

Reviews.Title: “bestens”
Reviews.Author: blumenstruck
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Brighton is centrally located and withn walking distance of so many of Paris’ best attractions. There is of course the Tuleries across the street. A No. 1 Metro station a block away. L’Auberge St. Roch around the corner. Etc. The Hotel is not large, but what it "lacks" in size it more than make up for in charm. True Parisian styled rooms. Spare, yet elegant. The staff was top rate, particularly the front desk: professional, but firendly. Highly recommend this the Hotel Brighton.

Reviews.Title: “Handy choice in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: LodonBrazilFrance
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a fantastic location. The deco is a bit run down, but overall not disappointing if you are not expecting too much. Staff at reception a bit frosty, but professional...breakfast simple with not many options. But thats normal in many french hotels. The only disappointment is room service. The hotels advertises room service when actually they order from a different place from outside...so if you need a cup of tea or coffee late in the evening...forget it!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: sla652
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at Hotel Brighton Oct. 21-25. Rooms are large and quiet with wonderful room darkening curtains. Bathrooms are updated and spacious by Paris standards. We found the front desk to be extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast is a bit sparse but the coffee is strong and hot. Try to book a room with a view it's worth the upcharge.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: Honeygatherer
Reviews.Content: WIlfried at the Front Desk was consistently unfriendly and unhelpful, bordering on rudeness. It would be hard to get his attention at the Reception, he tried to ignore me even when I was standing directly in front of him. In the Hotel guest computer an attachment to an email wouldnt open. He said they had just got an Apple and he didnt know how to work it. The faxes I asked him to send all got torn. The incoming faxes were illegible but the Hotel wouldnt do anyhting about it. In my booking request in the comments there was a request for a late check out at 4 pmas my flight was only at 630pm. Other staff at the Reception said they would try and accommodate and even if I could not stay on in the suite, they would try and put me in another room after 12. The next day another staff member confirmed that at least 1 PM was OK. But Wilfried unfortunately was there on the day of the check out and insisted on 12 noon. "The maximum I can give you is 12 noon" he emphasised. There was tension in the air. I got the clear feeling that if I made it 10 past 12, he would try to charge me another day. As a great favour he said " you can keep your luggage" which is a standard practice of Hotels.Jean Luc of the Bell Desk would not even acknowledge when I asked him in French to keep the luggage till the taxi came later for the airport. SOme other staff members were nice but that the Hotel management tolerates this kind of behaviour towards a guest speaks for the quality of service at the Hotel. I have stayed in 2 other Hotels of the same group - EspritdeFrance- Hotel des Saint Peres and Hotel Parc Saint Severin. BOth were excellent albeit classed as 3 star. Thats why I thought this would be even better. I dont know what facilities it has to qualify for 4 star, which it doesnt deserve

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: gaylene62
Reviews.Content: The staff were so friendly and helpful.We had a lovely big room over looking the roof tops and not the busy street as requested.The bathroom even had 2 basins in it ,which is hard to find in Paris.The position is proberly one of the best in Paris.Here was this beautiful little french hotel side by side with very expensive hotels and it was half the price.One can walk to any of the main tourist spots from here.I thought perhaps they could think about making the breakfast prices a lttle more reasonable and it would create more of a lovely gathering place to start your Paris day. There were never anymore than one or two people at one time having Breakfast there.The room was always beautifully clean and a pleasure to come back too.One day a very bad American man was giving the receptionist a very hard time over the fact his card didnt work to get in his room.He was so bad that he was abusing her.I was just at the point of intervening when he stormed off.I have to say the lady handled him with such dignty that I really admire her.Shame on him!! and over a silly little card.Thankyou Brighton ,we will be back again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location - but overpriced and bad service”
Reviews.Author: vaneegh
Reviews.Content: I've been to Brighton a few times the last years, and after this stay I've decided that this was my last stay here. To start with the good things, the location of the hotel is superb. If you book a room which has a view on the Jardin de Tuileries, Louvre, Tour Eiffel sights are astonishing. Across the street there is the Tuilleries metro station which is very convenient. Over the last few year I have seen the prices of this hotel rise, while service is getting worst. The rooms are very average (apart from the view), the beds are not very good (and did not seem very crisp&clean) and the pillows are very bad (too soft and no extra pillows in the closet). There are no coffee making facilities, no room service with hot meals, Wifi wasn't available in my room, etc. Breakfast is average as well, but overpriced (€19), better get a breakfast at some of the many restaurants located near (I can recommend Le Pain Quotidien at place du Marché St. Honoré) Service is not what you might expect for this price, people at the reception disinterested in their guests, hardly watching and greeting when you come in. I had to find my luggage myself in the luggage storing facility because the porter could not find it (while it was tagged with a label with a number on it..) What made me finally decide not to return to this hotel is that they charged me more that €50,- too much per night while checking out - when I mentioned this, the price was changed right away without checking my original booking or making any apologies. This made me feel a bit like they are trying to rip off every guest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NielStellenbosch
Reviews.Content: We found the location excellent but not value for money for a deluxe room . My wifes night gown was inadvertently removed with the bedding by the cleaning staff and in spite of repeated requests, to the front desk, no one appeared very keen to rectify or explain the situation. We left with the promise of a response but of course no luck yet after 15 days! In a previous review someone mentioned black particles in the hot water in the bath - well they still appear when the hot water is opened!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: peterm76
Reviews.Content: I stayed for six nights in September 2010. I booked this hotel because it's dead centre in the middle of Paris and close to everything - The Louvre, The Champs-Élysées and most importantly a Metro station. I cannot stress enough how important it is that a Paris hotel is near a Metro station. This is the only way to get around Paris, it's cheap and quick. The Tuileries Metro Station is a two minute walk away on the other side of the road. I booked a classic room (no street view but did have double windows looking out onto a courtyard) and was impressed with the huge size of the room! It was massive, especially by Paris standards. It was also clean and well appointed with a flat-screen t.v, bar-fridge, a safe, complimentary wi-fi and a huge bathroom with full sized bath. I dont know what their more upscale rooms are like but I can only imagine they're pretty special after staying in a classic room. All the staff were friendly and professional and all requests I made of them were fulfilled in a quick and friendly manner. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job and the room was clean and tidy every night I returned from sightseeing. On one occasion I threw out a set of earphones that I'd been given from a tour bus company as I didn't need them anymore. That night when I returned they had been placed back on the desk which is just above the bin. The housekeeper must have thought they had fallen in. I thought that was a nice gesture. I really cannot think of anything that I wasn't pleased with. I would definitely staff at this hotel again. It really contributed towards an enjoyable stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: rick416
Reviews.Content: The central location of the hotel by the Place Vendome is great Despite explicitely booking an executive room with a nice view of the Tuilarie Gardens, we were given a deluxe room on the second (just above ground level) floor with a view of the trees in the gardens. We were low enough that other views in the gardens, such as the fountains, were not visible. On checkout, I was initially billed for the executive room. The bill was promptly corrected when I pointed out the we had the deluxe room. When we initially checked in, we were given the deluxe room. We went up to the room, and it had not yet been cleaned. The maid showed up a few minutes later to clean the room. The room itself was good sized for Paris. It only had one sink. It was maintained well during our stay. Although, the staff were efficient if asked about something, they certainly did not go out of their way to be friendly. We were to be joined by my partners son. Despite asking at the front desk several times, they didn't deliver a note until that evening that he had sent in the afternoon stating that he was going to be delayed by a day. They next day, we returned to the hotel about 30 minutes before he was due to arrive and asked if there were any messages. Despite the assurance that there were none, as we were about to go up to the room, my friend saw a note on the desk. When she inquired about the note, we found that it was indeed a message that he had taken an earlier train and was waiting for us in a bistro next door. We had one breakfast at the hotel. This was entirely disappointing. There were cereals, some fruit, some of which was spoiled, and some pastries. Several of the pastries were in cellophane wrappers. There were some hot sausages but no eggs or other hot dishes. There were also several cheeses, one of which had blue mold growing around the sign that was labeling the cheese. The restaurant was only used for breakfast. The hotel did have a computer available for use without charge, and the rooms did have wireless connections available. All in all, it was at best an average experience.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, we stayed next door to The Maeurice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ohana808
Reviews.Content: yes, breakfast at the Maeurice Hotel is more than a night at the Brighton Hotel... we were impressed with the location, location, location at an affordable price!!!! One would think a room facing the rue Rivoli would be awesome...but we were lucky to have a room in the back to avoid the buzz from the street. Our room size was okay of adequate size...not too small. Catching the metro was convenient. The staff was friendly! We preferred to dine out for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING! THE PERFECT HOTEL FOR A FIRST TRIP TO PARIS”
Reviews.Author: Fred_Hill
Reviews.Content: I would recommend everyone who is visiting Paris for the first time stay at Hotel Brighton. We stayed in an Executive Room and paid in advance (Esprit Premium Plus deal) and received a huge discount. The room (on the fourth floor) was AMAZING, there is no other way to describe it. The bathroom was as big as most hotel rooms, then there was a separate sitting room and the bed and two "balconies" (just be warned they are not big balconies but just big enough to stand on). What makes this room is the view. You have an uninterrupted view of the Eiffel tower in the distance, (which you can see from your bed), the Louvre to your left and the Tuileries right in front of view. Note that there are two elevators, one that you can fit in with your luggage (further from reception) and one that I will call "romantic". The hotel is in the perfect location for a first time visit to Paris. There is a bus 100m from the hotel (walk outside and turn right) that takes you to the Eiffel Tower (#72) but apart from that you can walk everywhere. Private car to the airport should cost 40 - 45 EUR. If the hotel books it will cost 60 EUR so book yourself if you can. While you are here go to Angelina's for a hot chocolate. It is around 50m from the hotel. If the budget allows (and it is a special occasion) have dinner in the Eiffel Tower (58 Tour Eiffel). Apart from the novelty of having dinner in the Eiffel Tower, the food was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: MarciaB10
Reviews.Content: I spent many hours pouring through the 1800+ hotels in Paris on Trip Advisor trying to pick the perfect one for our first trip to Paris. I wanted a 4*, in a good location,(but didn’t know where) moderately priced, reasonably sized, and was hopeful of a view~. It was pretty easy to eliminate 80% based on stars or price -but that still left LOTS to sort through. I eventually narrowed the choice to 8 or so.. Finally picking the Hotel Brighton. They exceeded my expectations in every category. The location was excellent, the price was excellent-I prebooked and paid for (about 3 months in advance) a Esprit Premium room with a view *no changes or cancellations allowed* Our room(213) was lovely! I had been reading about all these small rooms in Paris. This was a very nice size room, with a King bed and sitting area. The room had two large French door that open onto the Rue di Rivoli, with views of the Eiffel Tower, Louvre, and gardens across the street. The views were AMAZING!!! After reading the previous posters complaints about the beds.. I have to disagree.. My husband and I are mid 50’s.. and he has a bad back that had been acting up.. We both found the bed very comfortable… but I know beds are a very personal preferences.. But just saying we both slept VERY well on it every night. All of the staff at Hotel Brighton were very helpful, knowledgeable, and kind. Especially Thomas, who helped me with a computer problem. The only minor complaint my husband had was with the shower.. It was small.. He compared it to a cruise ship shower.. And it had low pressure. It was different from what we are used to, but not bad.. (The bathroom was very large, including a tub AND a shower).. My only very minor complaint was they don’t include wash clothes with the towels.. I kept meaning to ask.. But forgot.. And yes, their elevators are small.. But so were all the others we used.. Pros.. Excellent views, good size room and bath, good location, friendly helpful staff, good price, VERY reasonable mini bar!!!! Wine priced about the same as local cafes! WOW!!! Have NEVER seen that.. AND.. We packed very light.. Needed to have some laundry done over the weekend.. I think not during their normal times.. But they got it done. We traveled to Brussels, Paris and London, and the Hotel Brighton was BY FAR my favorite hotel of the 3 I picked and researched through Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel... Except for the BEDS!”
Reviews.Author: KAHL1980
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in June in Room 307. It was for our 1-year anniversary. We were very pleased with nearly everything... except the beds were horrible which overshadowed all of the good! THE NOT-SO-GOOD: - The beds are very old, thin, creaky and covered with dated bedding. We are in our late-twenties, but it was difficult to fall asleep and in the morning our bodies ached. I asked the front desk if we could switch rooms or if there was anything they could do. The man stated that all of the rooms had the same beds and they used to have boards, but not anymore. I used all of the blankets we had to create a cushion on the mattress, though it didn't really help too much. - The evening front desk staff are not as good as the day staff. We asked for a couple restaurant recommendations, they gave us 1. When we asked if there was something else we could try they said "no". This is Paris... there are tonnes of restaurant nearby. - No washcloths. Bring your own. THE WONDERFUL: - Huge room! Other than the bed, fairly up-to-date. - Beautiful double balcony! - Huge, clean, modern bathroom with double sinks! - The day front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. Check-in was seamless. - Our room was ready 3 hours early and we were able to check-in early. - The bellman will gladly hail you a cab first thing in the morning. - Mac computer with internet for free use in the lobby lounge. - It was our anniversary and they had cold champagne and a fruit bowl waiting for us, no extra charge. - The hotel was very quiet. Maid staff was quiet and respectful in the halls in the morning. - AMAZING location! Very central, right across from Jardin du Tuilleries and the Louvre. (if you are light sleeper you may want earplugs for road noise) Overall, we would gladly return IF they update the beds. Otherwise, our backs cannot take the beds again. If they were replaced the hotel would be able to charge MUCH more due to location and room size. But if beds don't matter, this is the PERFECT place for a GREAT price!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent”
Reviews.Author: USTraveler012
Reviews.Content: I had not been to Paris prior to this visit. I had heard the general issues of poor service, uncaring staff and communication problems. The Hotel Brighton is the exact opposite of anything that you have or will hear. The hotel itself is exceptional. Perfectly located for any activity and has the most marvelous views of Paris. It is clean, classic style and is an excellent place to stay. The staff is extremely knowledgeable and very service oriented. They are attentive and provide the utmost in guest care. If you are planning your first visit or a return trip and have not stayed at the Hotel Brighton, I would highly recommend it to any and all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Best views in Paris, the Louvre, Tuileries Gardens and Eiffel Tower!!”
Reviews.Author: TwoNebraskaGuys
Reviews.Content: Best deal in Paris, with the best views. We had an executive room on the top floor with balcony and views that almost made you not want to leave the room! The hotel was extremely cozy and quaint, with the perfect French ambiance that really added to the romance. We watched the Eiffel Tower light show from our balcony every night while enjoying a bottle of wine before bed. I arranged the VIP welcome with flowers and champagne. The Roses were beautiful and the champagne and treats were the perfect way to start our trip. The management and staff were extremely helpful and courteous. They even helped us out with a 110 American to 220 European conversion plug for our laptop. Then upon check out they let us buy it for 20 Euro to use on the rest of our trip through Europe! That saved the day, because the converter we had bought prior to our trip blew up about 30 seconds after plugging it in! They all spoke English very well and were eager to help us with all our questions.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TonyFromSingapore
Reviews.Content: I got married on 31 Dec 2009 and decided to go Paris in winter for my honeymoon. The room rates in Paris are astronomically high compared with those in Singapore. So I had to 'settle' for Hotel Brighton after much research. I was disappointed by the small lobby initially but the reception at the front desk was terrific. They spoke English and were very warm and helpful. When we finally got to our room, it was nothing like the 5-star suites we can get for the same price here but it was cosy and distinctly Parisienne. The staff had also surprised us with a box of Godiva chocolates as our honeymoon present! We stayed there for 5 nights and the charm of the room and the hotel grew so much on us. The view of the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre garden was amazing and even though it was freezing, my wife and I enjoyed staying outside the small balcony and look at the occassional crazy jogger willing to brave the cold to exercise. The location was simply fantastic. The subway was literally just right across the hotel and it was within walking distance to many attractions nearby. There are also many famous pastry shops just right the corner. I totally encourage you to splurge at least once on a breakfast at Angelina's just a few steps down the hotel. It's an experience we will never forget. I'm thankful for the many honest reviews which people have posted that have helped me book this hotel for my honeymoon. I feel that I should pay it forward and help post my review to now enable others make an informed choice. It's not your Ritz or Westin but the charm of Hotel Brighton is worth every cent I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, last-minute booking”
Reviews.Author: LukeBris90
Reviews.Content: We were stuck in the middle of the volcanic ash cloud in Europe so we had to miss out on one of our destinations and go straight to Paris and eventually got there 2 days before we were meant to. On the train we used the net on our mobile phones and chose Hotel Brighton for 2 nights. Our accommodation that we were meant to stay in was fully booked for the 2 nights prior to our check in so we had to stay somehwere else. The staff at Hotel Brighton were exceptionally welcoming and we had a great room. Although check in is not until 2pm, we were let in to our room at 9:30am. Our room was large with 2 wardrobes and double basin vanity in the bathroom. Shower had lousy water pressure. Breakfast was nice, there was not a lot of variety although it was set up really nicely and the food was beautiful. The hotel offers rooms service so we though after the days we had had we would stay in for a night and order of the gourmet menu. I couldn't believe it when they brought the food up, it was sandwiches in plastic containers as were the desserts. We were very appauled although we couldn't complain as there are not too many hotels throughout Europe that offer room service like in Australia. Concierge was helpful finding a Laundrette and the location was quite good. Becuase we booked last minute, we paid top dollar for the base room 280euro per night but even so I thought this hotel was worth it. A real Gem.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel near Paris Vision for excursions”
Reviews.Author: graceNewBrunswick
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its closeness to Paris Vision for the excursions we planned. The location is excellent! We asked for a quiet room and in #401 we got it! By Canadian standards ($295.00) a night, it was expensive but Paris is expensive! Unlike Canada, there was no coffee maker in the room; a continental breakfast was not included. Willing to pay the price, you can not beat the location! Close to the Louvre Museum made it worth it! The early morning staff member, Pierre, was most helpful and kind in booking Eurostar for us, when our flight did not come through for us! (because of the Dust cloud/ origin Iceland)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Alexandre92100
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the location wich is really extremely convinient. I wasn't expecting much. My God what a nice surprise! First, we arrived at 10am and were sure that the room wouldn't be ready before 2pm. Well it was ready and it's so good to take a shower after 11h in a plane! The room was on the 4th floor, #409. Amazing view, probably the best in Paris. The tuileries and the Louvre in front of you, the Eiffel tower on the right. Room was an executive, very big, huge bathroom, very comfortable and with a small balcony! Nice staff, cosy decoration. I was fearing the noise of the rue de rivoli as this is one of the busiest street in Paris but the 2 windows were soundproof and we slept very well. The cherry on the cake was to wath the paris firemen running in the jardin des tuileries in the morning ;-) I strongly recomment this hotel. However, one point: we didn't see any bag for laundry service

Reviews.Title: “What a view!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisatini1013
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Brighton in 2008. After researching all the hotel options on Tripadvisor I chose the Brighton based on its view, location and the very positive comments from other travelers. Did I mention the view?? I was happy to find the comment were true. Our room was located on the top floor and it ended up being much bigger than I has expected. The bathroom was large with a seperate toilet area. The room was very clean and comfortable. There was a dormer window which opened providing us with an amazing view of the Louvre and the Eiffel Tower in the distance. The Tuileries next to the Lourve are very peaceful to look at after a long day of sightseeing. Metro station was very close. Some of the most expensive hotel's in Paris are a few doors down. For the same view (actually a little better); stay at the Hotel Brighton and spend the money on a nice romantic dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! View of Eiffel Tower and the Louvre!”
Reviews.Author: cwaddell74
Reviews.Content: My huband, our 7 year-old son and I stayed here in June last year. I am ready to go back! The staff was wonderful, and most of them spoke English. They were friendly and helpful to us. We booked a suite, but we were upgraded and moved to a room facing the Eiffel Tower and The Louvre when our room smelled like something was burning. It may have been the heater on the wall. The room was large and had a huge bathroom. The marble bathroom was nicer than most luxury hotels in America.
