I was very impressed with the hotel and the location was excellent. Seeing the Eiffel tower each night from our room was amazing. Our son could lie in his rollaway bed (which was nice) and watch the tower light up as he was going to sleep. The hotel is very near the metro stop and close to shops and resturants. I would highly recommend this hotel. It had all the charm and historic aspects we were looking for in a hotel. It is unique and not cookie-cutter style like hotel chains are. We will definitely stay there when we return to Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brighton-Paris”
Reviews.Author: JoanG6
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel at a good price. Location on the Rue de Rivoli was convenient to the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay and great shopping and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: David1975AA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 days and found it to be very nice. The room was clean, warm, and comfortableand the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. They provided free internet access in the hotel lobby, which I used to check my e-mails and attraction information. The hotel had a small restaurant, and there were several restaurants just down the street. The hotel is convenient to attractions and the tour bus stop. It is just across the street from the Tuileries and down the street from the entrance to the Louvre. I would recommend this hotel, and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the location, the hotel is nice but not four star”
Reviews.Author: neilyork
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed here in January 2010 for my birthday weekend. We paid £503 for three nights in a standard room using booking.com Finding the hotel is very easy (short walk from Tuileries Metro station) and it also felt like it was in an upmarket part of Paris very close to La Louvre. We were warmly greeted and in no time at all had our room on the 5th floor allocated. The room itself was quite big but basic compared to most four star hotels. We also found the quilt of the bed to be stained but all other sheets were ok. As someone else said though, a duvet would have been nicer. The mini bar prices were not over the top and we took tea in our room on three occasions for which we were not charged at all. Nice touch. Breakfast is a whopping 23Euro per person per day so we opted out of that and took breakfast at a local cafe for 8Euro each per day - just as nice and a fraction of the price. Overall, I would stay here again but only because it's the cheapest of the hotels in the area. It didn't feel like a proper four star hotel and that's my only negative observation. True, you can get far far better four star hotels in Paris but not at this price in the Rivoli area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boothills
Reviews.Content: Great view from the fourth floor. Friendly staff. Large rooms. We really enjoyed our stay. The lounge with the computer is nice. I like the little touches like a bookcase with books in our room.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL WITH A VIEW !”
Reviews.Author: AYAGreece
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights in this hotel, during our Christmas vacation and we have nothing to complain . Staff was kind and helpfull, breakfast was wonderfull, room was really comfortable with a really spacious bathroom and perfectly cleaned every day. My twin daughters (5 years old) were sleeping in a very comfortable open - coach. I advice you to try and have breakfast included and you will have a great value for money. And last but not least our room (309) had THE MOST WONDREFULL VIEW . In a way you can see Paris without going out.... and the tour Eiffel from your bed. As it was snowing during our stay and was really cold out , it was very nice to sit near the window and drink the take -away hot chocolate from Angelina's nearby cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, old room”
Reviews.Author: Pitiniaou
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Brighton is perfectly situated on the rue de Rivoli just opposite les jardins des Tuileries. You can easily walk almost everywhere but if you wish to take the metro, the Tuilerie station is situated across the road. The front desk staff were really polite and helpful. I had a standard room and I was surprise by the dimensions which were bigger than expected. All the rooms have been refurbished not long ago which is impossible to notice. The decoration was really basic and looks more like a 2 stars than a 4 stars hotel, the bedspread was really old fashioned. I am used to have some fine linen when I go to a 4 stars hotel with some really soft and fluffy duck feathers duvets and pillow but the Brighton hotel’s rooms only have an horrible brown blanket; the kind of cover that you can expect to find in a youth hostel. Finally, my room had a strong smell of mould. I didn’t bother asking for another room because I was there for 1 night only but this is definitively not the kind of smell you would expect in a 4 stars. My parents where in a suite which had a good dimension with bath and shower. They had the same problem with the decoration which had the same old and tired theme as in my room. The furniture was really basic with only one two seaters sofa in the living room and without coffee table. I can’t complain too much with the suite because it was almost the same price as the standard room. And if the standard room is expensive for what you have the suite isn’t.

Reviews.Title: “Location and view.......perfect for a visit to Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Tobie
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 nights at the Hotel Brighton---- this being our first trip to Paris. Although the room we had (212) overlooking Rue de Rivoli was nice enough, it was the view of the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre and Jardin Tuileries that was exceptionally memorable. We planned to spend a good deal of time at the Musee D'Orsay (a 10 min walk) and the Louvre (6 min walk) so for us this location was perfect. We also easily strolled from the Hotel Brighton to Napoleon's Tomb, Place de la Concorde and the Arc de Triomphe, Notre Dame and Saint Chapelle. All on our top 10 list of places to visit in Paris. The room itself was probably on par with a newer Holiday Inn---which meant everything was clean and spacious with lots of storage, an in room safe, desk, large bathroom with separate shower and tub and free wifi. The bed was comfortable, the room was cleaned and toiletries and towels refreshed daily, and we found it very quiet with both sets of French doors closed to the Rue de Rivoli. But while other hotels can offer all this, it was the tiny "balcony" which allowed you to sit admiring one of the most spectacular views (glass in hand) that was unforgettable. It was something we never tired of any time of the day when we happened to stop in to the room, but the view was especially wonderful in the evening. We found the all the staff most helpful with luggage, directions and dinner reservations, and after accidentally locking the safe with the wrong code on a Friday, even the manager came in on the weekend to assist us since our flight was leaving Sunday at 7am. The hotel arranged an airport shuttle for us to CDG as well. We could not have asked for more in terms of service. The breakfast buffet for 16 euros was convenient for a few mornings with yogurt, pastries, cereal, fresh fruit, juices and coffee but you can also eat off site. The restaurants in the area we enjoyed the most in the evening were Chez Flottes, Le Souffle and Louise's Cafe---all within easy walking distance. Just 2 blocks away were convenience stores for snacks or cold drinks. Yes, the price of 230 euros/night (paid in advance for the rate) was expensive, but we have paid similar prices in New York, London and Rome with no view. This was definitely a room with a view!

Reviews.Title: “EXPENSIVE!”
Reviews.Author: chicka_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Brighton Hotel in Paris for 3 days in September and the rooms are quite old and the breakfast is not worth the 17 euros that we pay for each person per day. Also, we paid for our breakfast for Sunday but it turned out that there was not breakfast on that day. Otherwise, the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: jw9691
Reviews.Content: spent 5 nights at the brighton and overall was pleased with the hotel. other than some nice details in the bathrooms and flat screen tvs, it's hard to tell the rooms have been upgraded, but they were perfectly fine. staff was generally very nice, and the location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “I can't imagine a better location - or view - in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CherryHintonBlue
Reviews.Content: Sure, it's expensive (although there's expensive, like this, and REALLY expensive, not that far away), but the room we had (111) was a decent size, especially for Paris, with a nice bathroom. And with a location like this, who's complaining? Our room had a balcony, which was tiny but allowed you to step out and take in the view (see photo) from the Louvre one way, to the Tuileries gardens opposite, as far as the Eiffel Tower in the distance. It was gorgeous. And the road may be busy, but the soundproofing was amazing. Very clean hotel, very nice service, decent breakfast too. If you're "doing the galleries", this is the location to be in. It's 5 minutes walk to the Louvre, 10 minutes across the park to the Orangerie, and 10 minutes across the park and river to the Musee d'Orsay. And a lovely walk too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: ESPNYC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is central to everything! All major train lines are very close. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. We did not eat at the hotel but Angelina is right down the block and good for a BIG breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great view.”
Reviews.Author: boazleung
Reviews.Content: Great location, and we got the view of the Louve and Eiffel Tower. The bathroom was much bigger than average hotels in Paris. Staff were also very helpful and friendly. Will return again.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Frence Experience”
Reviews.Author: Janinchicago
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on Trip Advisor about this hotel...they were all true! The Hotel Brighton is in the perfect location for Paris, in walking distance to everything. It is right across from the Louve and the Tulleries Jardin which you can walk to everything. Staff is courteous and delightful. Some front desk staff was not as helpful or friendly as others. We got to know right away who you could asks questions. But all provided good insights. The beds were great and try to get the breakfast included with your stay...its an easy way to start your long day of sightseeing. The city is magnificent and this hotel was excellent! Our only complaint was the lack of towels and their quality. But if you're looking for a great place in Paris -- stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Room, Service, Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelertoEurope
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights in Brighton. We booked it via booking.com. and I was a bit afraid of getting inferior treatment because of that. In contrary, we were upgraded to a room with a fabulous view at Louvre and the Tuileries garden. The room was large even by the US standards, very clean, and had the old French charm. The bathroom had a separate shower and bath, and was spacious as well. The staff was very friendly and spoke English. The location of the hotel is perfect for exploring Paris by foot. I would highly recommend the hotel. While on some some sites it is rated as 3 stars, it is definitely qualifies for 4- 4.5 stars, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further! Hotel Brighton is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveler84
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous. Wonderful location, helpful staff, and perfectly appointed and clean rooms. The rooms are big for Paris, and beautifully designed. I was traveling with my mom and both of us have been to Paris many times before and this is without question the best hotel we've stayed in. Stay here and you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: globeToronto
Reviews.Content: i must admit, i was very worried prior to arriving at the brighton. coming from north america, i had my share of deceptions from European hotels. brughton is very well located, and the rooms are above average for the pricepoint. i definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mel_and_ken
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Brighton for an entire week and were very satisfied with our stay. The English-speaking staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean (with the exception of a leaking air conditioning unit), and the bathroom was also clean and comfortable. The tv had English-speaking channels, which was nice (my husband is an avid CNN viewer). Breakfast was not included, and for the expensive price, it is NOT worth it to dine at the hotel. In general, the stores on Rue du Rivoli, where the hotel is located are tourist traps (sub-quality, over-priced products/food), so avoid patronizing them at all costs. The best part about the hotel is it's superb location. It's located immediately in front of the Tuileries Gardens and a short walk away from the Louvre. The Metro is right across the street, making it quite accessible to other sights. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! Modest luxury with a real French feel.”
Reviews.Author: FlyNavyJD
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on previous reviews from Trip Advisor and other sites, the location of the hotel, and familiarity with Paris from a previous trip. My wife and I stayed four nights for a vacation, and the experience was excellent. Positives were location, room size and amenities, view, and price. No negatives. Location - Ideal for walking to many prominent sights, from Notre Dame to Champs Elysees. We paid 10 Euros max for taxis to other locations we visited, or when going out for dinner (Eiffel Tower, Isle de la Cite, Latin Quarter, etc). Tons of cafes nearby, of course the Louvre and Tuileries Garden, ATMs within a block, and multiple markets within 2 blocks (on Rue St. Honore) including bakery, convenience store, and wine shops. We shopped at these markets to get snacks/water for our daily outings and to get picnic dinner items for an evening trip to the Eiffel Tower (only concern was having to be conscious of the hours they were open). Hotel – Room was 4 nights for price of 3 (Fri-Tues), third floor Tuileries Garden view with king size bed. Room had sofa with pull-out bed, desk, mini fridge, recently remodeled bathroom (very modern with tub and separate shower), narrow balcony overlooking Tuileries/Louvre, and flat-screen TV (true only one channel in English, but who cares…go for a walk or read a book on the balcony!). View and location were well worth the price (avg $324 US per night). Did not bring laptop so we used free computer/internet in lobby without problems. Also, room was very quiet…double French doors on balcony sealed out noise from Rue de Rivoli and even from carnival rides in Tuileries Garden. Hotel did not seem crowded, especially for the heavy tourist period over a weekend in mid August…we only saw other guests when walking past the dining room in the morning on our way out. Service – Staff was not rude, but were also not exceedingly attentive…in a word they were “French” so what would you really expect?! Room was cleaned daily, and bell hop and maid were both very friendly. All employees we had contact with spoke at least some english. Did not have breakfast there so cannot comment (we did eat at Angelina though...three times, definitely a must-visit cafe for everyone!). Overall – If your expectation is reasonable and you get a decent promotional price, this hotel is a great find. Note that I did look into nearby luxury hotels and they were nearly twice the price without the view (Westin, Maurice, etc). If you are used to luxury hotels in the US and UK, Hotel Brighton is probably a little too down-to-earth for you…and you probably don’t research your hotels online, so this is a moot point…but I digress. I would recommend Hotel Brighton to others and I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: TexasCaboose
Reviews.Content: Have to agree with most of the previous reviews. Great location. Very clean. Formal, but very courteous staff. Good internet rates. Free use of computers. Crowded with tourists in front along Rue de Rivoli. Area behind the hotal was great with shops, stores, bars, restaurants, etc. Easy to metro and buses. Didn't have breakfast there, so can't comment. The main reason reason we stayed there, was also the best part. The view from the balcony was fantastic. The best.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: UsaAnnam
Reviews.Content: Traveled with husband, two married daughters and spouses. We stayed here 3 nights. The rooms were very clean, staff helpful, and location excellent. We were able to walk to everything we had planned to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Should be a 5 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OLIVIER-JOANIN
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Brighton 5 times (last time for 12 nights), and would never consider any other hotel in Paris for everything this hotel offers. The service is impeccable, the rooms are spotless and huge, the location is fantastic (metro station across the street and 2 blocks walking from Rue St Honore) and the view is to die for (Arc de Triomphe, Tour Eiffel, Le Louvre, Musée d'Orsay, Jardin des Tuileries...all from my bedroom balcony !!!).

Reviews.Title: “Everything I hoped for and more”
Reviews.Author: caseyLI
Reviews.Content: This hotel was reviewed in National Geographic World Traveler as a four star hotel with a three star price. It was that and more. Location could not be better for walking, taking the metro or joining a tour. The staff was welcoming and helpful to non french speaking guests. Only regret is requesting a room overlooking the courtyard and the courtyard was a work area in the back of the hotel. The rooms overlooking the Tuilleries Gardens may have been nosier due to road traffic but would have been an outstanding view. Would stay there again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned....”
Reviews.Author: discovery2106
Reviews.Content: Whilst I didn't stay here I booked it for my parents who spent three days at the hotel. I wouldn't usually write a review in third person but my parents were treated so rudely I think it is worth warning others. They had travelled for 8 weeks around Europe and they said this was the most disappointing hotel they stayed in. The staff were unaccommodating, unfriendly and basically rude. If you are looking for a home away from home in Paris - spend your 260 Euros a night elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Overall - A Good Value”
Reviews.Author: NomadDad
Reviews.Content: First, I must say that the hotel was quite a bit smaller than I expected based on pictures I had seen. That wasn't a problem - but it was different than I had expected. The Staff was very professional and courteous across the board. All spoke english very well (which was great, because my french was terrible) and they were all very responsive and helpful. Our room was large with a beautiful view that you can see all over the reviews on this site - so I won't post more pictures. It was hot during our stay and the air conditioner did not work as well as they have to in Texas. The room decor overall was three stars except the carpet was a one star and the bathroom(s) (separate toilet room) was four stars. The sleeper sofa - which our two teens slept on - was the most comfortable pull out couch I have ever laid on. I thought the location of the hotel was perfect for touring sights throughout the city. The one big fault during our trip was listening to a recommendation by the front desk to eat down the street on Rue de Rivoli at L'Imperial. It seemed like a decent place when we were eating there - except I ordered a couple of "specials" recommended by the server which turned out to be OUTRAGEOUSLY priced - which was a shock when we got our bill - because most items on the menu seemed to be priced within the stratosphere. The off-menu "specials" were the perfect trap for stupid tourists. Our bill ended up costing me $240 US for nothing more than simple sandwich/soup fare. I don't like "getting taken for a ride", so I would never, ever go back to L'Imperial. If you do, stick to the menu and make sure you have verified ALL prices (including drink (even water)). Angelinas was terrific. The front desk also recommended restaurants at the Place du Marché Saint-Honoré. It is a short stroll away from the hotel and there are many, many great eating options there. We ate at several places there and enjoyed all of them - very reasonably priced also. Overall, I would definitely stay the the Brighton again - but probably not my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in the Spring time”
Reviews.Author: Reno12
Reviews.Content: What I can tell you is,that it is a perfect hotel to take a Granddaughte to. The staff and director of the hotel were very pleasant and helpful with a problem I was having with my plane reservation. The room could not have been more perfect. The room had a balcony that faced the Tuileries and the Eiffel Tower..See Picture's....Would I stay there again, without question.

Reviews.Title: “Not mind blowing, given what I paid. Stayed in 5 star hotels for less.”
Reviews.Author: Sheba_Adams
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Paris with my Grandmother and was quite eager to find somewhere that was central but more important with a fantastic view, for my Grandmother's sake. I found this hotel with a wonderful location, almost too good to be true, and the reviews about it seemed especially encouraging. When we arrived the hotel lobby was a bit small, but coming from London I wasn't too hung up on cramped spaces, but the room had a nice view of the Jardin des Tuileries, the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower, the Musee d'Orsay (pics attached). The room was spacious and felt a bit empty, the television was small and awkwardly positioned given the size of the room, the little fridge was a funny imitation of a mini bar, but the bathroom was nice and spacious with a shower and bathtub, and the bathroom was in a seperate room with it's own sink. We were content as the room and bathroom seemed clean. However during our 3 night stay the room was not vaccumed, the sheets were not changed and one night after taking a shower I found that they had not left us any big towels with only hand and floor towels on the rack. After we left I found that I had forgotten my house keys in the room, I called them and they confirmed that they had found them and I asked them to send them to me, which they said they would. I do not know if they would have contacted me to tell me I had forgotten them, but from their tone of voice I don't think they would have. I received my keys a ridiculous 10 days later, which is pathetic considering that I'm just across the channel. Again the staff didn't get back to me to update me, I had to call and kept hanging on the line for about 10 minutes until they remembered I was there, then the emails I received from there directed me to a French website, the link they sent me was mis-spelt, that I couldn't make tails or heads of, and a series of emails ensued between us until I had to ask them to look at the site and tell me what it said. They seemed very unwilling to take an extra step. The service from the hotel staff was civil enough, although I have seen much friendlier. And in all, given the money that I was spending there, I was disappointed in the quality of the room. Some of the staff were very friendly and chatty, but I found the majority a bit sullen and surly, however I found that most French service providers are that way. I enjoyed my stay in Paris very much, but I've stayed in 5 star hotels that didn't charge as much as this hotel and where every conceivable comfort was available. Furthermore, no room service to speak of, the restaurant was only open for breakfast, again if I compare to other hotels, given what I was paying, I should have been getting a whole lot more. I will not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tawnyafitz
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Brighton is an excellent hotel. We stayed from June 29-July 4 2009. We were in room 213 with an fabulous view of the Louvre and gardens. We could also see the Eiffel Tower from our window. The location is wonderful. Close enough to walk to Musee D'Orsay, L'Orangerie museum, Les Invalides, Notre Dame, Centre Pompidou , Galeries Lafayette and we even walked back from the Eiffel Tower. Many nice cafes near by. The staff was polite, pleasant and always helpful. We will definitely stay there again if we are lucky enough in life to travel to Paris again. Beware of women trying to give you a gold ring that it appears they have picked up right in front of you! A nice local on the bridge saw us being scammed and stepped in and warned us not to listen to her! Versailles was gorgeous ( but hot!) and only about 30 minutes away on the RER train.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location and decent accommodations”
Reviews.Author: DDtravelTexas
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is fantastic! It is located accross from the Tuilerries Gardens and the Louvre with easy access to the Metro. The staff is apathetic and not entirely helpful but the locaion makes up for their lack of service. The room was not renovated and very dated. We did ask for a newly renovated room and they told us this room was! The mattress and pillows were hard and the bathroom left much to be desired. The shower had minimal water pressure and the blow dryer was unacceptable. We did enjoy the breakfast buffet and the hotel is located a block from Angelina's, a wonderful tea room--the hot chocolate is not to be missed! We did pay for location with little service and a sufficent room. We would stay here again for the location. It is Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shaw67
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a wonderful trip. My husband, myself, our daughter age 14 and son age 12. We stayed in the Tuilleries executive room on the 4th floor. Great views of the Louvre, the Tuilleries Garden, the Musee d'Orsay, the Eiffel Tower, just beautiful!! The room had a king size bed and a pull out sofa bed that accomodated us very well. The bathroom was huge with a tub and seperate shower. The staff at the front desk spoke english and were very helpful in telling us where places were and what time it closes. Our luggage didn't make it with us, but thankfully it came the next day and they placed it in our room while we were out sightseeing. I was drying my hair and some lights went out - Oppps- ;-) and called down and they fixed it right away and came up just to make sure. My husband left his sunglasses downstairs in the breakfast lounge and a nice young man ( sorry I can't remember his name) came up to the room to return it to us. The housekeeping staff was very nice. Right next to the metro. Would stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great View”
Reviews.Author: SirVino
Reviews.Content: We were on the 4th floor, overlooking the Tuilleries Garden. The view was great. The room was beautiful. The staff helped us every step of the way. They all spoke English. The TV in the room was a little small, but that's not why we were in Paris. For this location (Rue d' Rivoli), overlooking the Gardens, with this level of luxury, it was the best deal around.

Reviews.Title: “Continues to earn top ratings as a Value/Location property in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ivanciment
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this hotel a year ago when I last visited. Continues to be excellent value at a great location. Breakfast is still excellent; i had the 4th floor executive suite which gives you a great view of all the major landmarks. Same staff still there after a year; i had no issues with service; they made phone calls for me to get reservations and find out things i wanted to know. Wouldn't mind more TV channels but what is there is adequate. Room decoration and amenities are perfectly fine. No reason to stay in the 5-star hotels here unless you require a gym and a spa.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location but let down by the front desk staff!”
Reviews.Author: aussiesroaming
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three nights in June in an Executive Tulleries View Room. The view was spectacular and the room was very spacious and clean. The location was great for getting to all the main tourist sights and close to several metro stations. The staff that cleaned the rooms and the door staff were very polite, helpful and efficient at their jobs. However, both my husband and I found the front desk staff very stand offish from the word go. On the first day we asked for some basic info on the sights and direction to the train station, but the front office staff seemed almost annoyed to answer our questions. We then asked to use the internet for a short while to check the status of our tours for the next few days. It was the bell boy/doorman that helped us with that and gave us a code to use the internet free. Unfortunately the internet took about 10 minutes to come up and we could not get on to anything but local tourist sights so could not check our email for our tour updates. I advised the lady at the front desk that the internet was not working properly and she just shrugged. I asked her to look into it and went to another hotel to use their internet. We tried the internet to complete online checkin for our flights upon checkout and it was still exactly the same and we could not check in online. The morning we checked out I called the front office and asked if we could possibly leave a bit later than middat as our flight was not til late that night. He replied very abruptly "No!". At about 11.45am we had a knock on the door asking us to check out as they had to clean the room. We did not expect late checkout, but did not expect the attitude we got from the front desk staff. Upon checking out at midday the man at the front desk did not smile and had a very rude tone to his voice and then made comments about not using the hotels shuttle service. I had inquired about the hotels shuttle service and I had been quoted 60 euro per one way transfer and was aked to contact them with my arrival details if I wanted it. We got transfers on line which did the same thing for 30 euro one way. We travelled for 4 weeks in Europe before staying at the Brighton Hotel and were looking forward to our stay based on previous reviews, but we left feeling annoyed and would not stay there again despite the location as we discovered severel hotels in a similar location that provided better service.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: itinerant2
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 arrived at 8am transatlantic and brain dead,the manager was most solicitous in getting us into our apartment suite hours ahead of posted check-in. Location is ideal across from Tuilleries and Metro stop. 3 blocks from Louvre. Apartment suite was very spacious, clean, updated for center of major european metro area. Easily accommodated 2 adults and 2 teens. Front desk was most helpful, all fluent in English and could direct us to whatever we wanted. Bathroom outstanding for space,amenities, and endless towels without having to ask. Have stayed in Paris three times now. Would definitely come back here.(Previous stay was Hotel d'Louvre)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brighton”
Reviews.Author: MoscowAlexei
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent choice for us for the first trip in Paris. A very suitable location and a nice view to all major tourist attractions such as Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, Eifel Tower, Jardin de Thuilliery. It is very calm and quiet inside despite it is situated just in the heart of Paris. Of course it is not Louvre but we were pleasntly surprised by the antiquе furniture in our room. The hotel is very clean and cosy. Our room was not very spacious but it had a separate bathroom, toilet and even wardrobe. The stuff is very friendly and some can speak several foreign languages, even Russian. Breakfast is nice and there's a variety of dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Title: Modern and old in the greatest point of Paris ID *: 30894291”
Reviews.Author: nossa
Reviews.Content: Visiting Paris, choose this wonderful hotel Brighton that is located in rue Rivoli directly opposite to park Tyuilri and the Louvre. You will be met with the affable and polite personnel speaking English and even Russian. For example, the Cuban receptionist has finished one of the Moscow universities. Rooms in the hotel are well designed, cosy and clean. And what is unusual to Paris they are spacious, have high ceilings and windows. The majority of them leave on park where among statues and fountains people walk, make jogs or just having rest on chairs and grass. Bathrooms are modern and recently renewed. We were shown different rooms on a choice, and we choose light room with big window, big ancient mirrow and mysterious portrait of a young man of 19 century. If before the hotel you find many sights: the Louvre, park Tyuilri, and very near on the other side of the Seine - a museum d’Оrsay, Sainte Chapelle and Notre Dame, the quarter located behind the hotel, is full of boutiques and shops of known designers. Famous Rue Sante Honore is right there. The Location of the hotel is very convenient. If you prefer to move by underground, the station Tyuilri is directly at your legs. Before you walk, do not forget to try the French or continental breakfast in a pleasant atmosphere with the waiters, serving tea or coffee. The breakfast proceeds till 11 o'clock so you have a chance to sleep long.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful escape in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: CountessLV
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 12 night stay at Hotel Brighton and we can't say enough about the hotel and especially the staff. The location speaks for itself and we were able to walk to all the major attractions in Paris. Fabulous to have the Tuliere Gardens across the street. Hotel is impeccably clean, rooms were large with lots of closet space, big windows that we could open, updated bathroom and very comfortable bed. Room service was great when we had it and reasonable long distance phone rates when dialing directly from your room. The staff are the stars of this hotel and went out of their way again and again for us. My husband needed to see a doctor and the hotel arranged to have a doctor attend on him in our room within 20 minutes of us making the request. Our room safe managed to get stuck and they also dealt with that problem with speed and courtesy. So grateful to the stafff and would stay at this hotel again without hesitation!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely worth it!”
Reviews.Author: europe_tvlr
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Brighton in a prestige tuileries view room with the 3rd bed option. In a word...spectacular. We stayed in room 410, which is a nice large open room. The 3rd bed was a pull out couch, but it was extremely comfortable and no problem, nor complaints from a 12 year old. There WC is separate from the spacious bathroom, but it is a little odd to walk from the WC through the bedroom to the bathroom to wash your hands. Not a big deal, though. There are extra blankets and pillows in the closets, if needed. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom had nice ammenities. The staff was very nice and helpful. The view from the room is breathtaking. From our two 'balconies' you could see the Eiffel Tower, tuileries, louvre, and everything in between. Fantastic. The hotel includes free wireless internet. The speed isn't that great, but it was nice to have access and not have an additional fee. Angelina's cafe is just 2 doors down, so a great place to take a break and have some of their famous hot chocolate.

Reviews.Title: “The view!”
Reviews.Author: KarenandBryan
Reviews.Content: I simply loved our stay at the Hotel Brighton. We splurged and got the Priveledge Room with the view. So worth it! That little balcony I sat many a hours just watching the crowds pass by. I would highly recommend this hotel. Our room was spacious and clean. Very nice bathroom with separate toilet. Well worth the $$. Great staff too! Elio was more than helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced 2-star masquerading as a 3 or 4 star in good location.”
Reviews.Author: Randall47
Reviews.Content: We chose the Brighton based on comments posted on Trip Adviser. The people are pleasant and you can't beat the location. But make no mistake. This is a 2 star hotel that charges what a 4 star hotel asks. The internet in the guest lobby didn't work and we had to use the hotel's business computer to deal with emails. The room was tiny and very expensive for what it was. This is not a bad hotel. It's simply Spartan and you shouldn't fork up the dough for staying here when a lot of superior alternatives are available.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for your money and unbelievable views with top notch service”
Reviews.Author: sweedies
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 9-night stay at the Hotel Brighton and we were so pleased with our stay. We stayed in a Privilege Tuileries View room on the top floor and the views of the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, Les Invalides and the Eiffel Tower were magnificent. The staff was so helpful and accomodating with everything from room selection, restaurant reservations, transportation booking and baggage handling. They even got us a doctor to the room within 30 minutes! The breakfast was perfect for our needs and the waiters were so friendly and pleasant. The room had a loft feel and layout. It felt like our very own Paris apartment. See the pics. I would definitely stay here again, if I get the chance, and I can recommend it to you.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: teafree
Reviews.Content: We had just stayed in the Cadge in London, which was fantastic and landed here... Suffice to say, our room was more expensive and not nearly as nice. It was very quiet, on the interior courtyard. The location is fantastic and do stay here if that is what you are looking for. Breakfast was a Fawlty Towers experience, not without laughs. So the next day we went out for breakfast and had a fantastic one. The staff at the front desk barely tolerated us, or anyone else as far as I could see. We did book this hotel due to other comments on Trip Advisor, but we didn't have the same experience. I do prefer the left bank hotels and would have stayed there but the couple traveling with us preferred this location. I would recommend it if they insisted on this location.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Paris Hands Down”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastTraveler062
Reviews.Content: I hate even writing this because I am afraid that the hotel will get to busy, but it is too good to be kept a secret. I go to Paris a few times a year, and have stayed in quite a few hotels. I used to think that the Four Seasons was the best, but for the price, room size, location and view, Brighton is the best without doubt. The front desk was the kindest and most helpful I have ever met. Every restaurant they suggested was out of this world. Mohammad was particularly fantastic. Make sure you get a room with a view of the Louvre and you WILL NOT be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Herkbert
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Brighton during Christmas week 2008 and thought it was terrific. We stayed in a prestige room with a Tuileries garden view that was just as advertised. It had a spectacular view from our balcony that was very romantic. The room was very spacious and clean. There was a king size bed that was quite comfortable, and plenty of pillows. There was a desk in the room, plus an easy chair and ottoman. The bathroom was large and had two sinks, plus a separate tub and shower. which was very convenient when getting ready to go out. There was also a separate WC. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, confirming dinner reservations when we needed a bit of help. We would definitely stay at the Hotel Brighton again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: eap-cruiser
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about Hotel Brighton! We arranged transfers from the airport thru the hotel, we were met right after customs, the driver took our bags, wisked us off to the hotel very quickly. We did the tranfters back thru the hotel also and it was very effecient. We arrived about 10:30 a.m., they put our suit cases in a locked room and we took off up the champ elssy, stopping at Angelina's on the way. Angelina's is 3 doors down from the hotel!! we got into our room @ 1:30, 5th floor, two dormer type windows, out of which we saw all of Paris, the Louvre, Orsay, tulleries, grand palace, effile tower and even arch de trimph if you leaned out a ways! unbelivable!! the pics our our windows were incredible. we were booked for 2 twin beds, but got 1 king, not a big deal it was my daughter (17) and me. didn't have a shower, but they gave us bath salts every day, so we took nice long hot baths each night. flat screen w/cable, only english channel was CNN international. room was plenty big for us. only down side? no alarm clock, guess i'm spoiled by american hotels that have that. they did do wake up calls for us when needed. room was always clean, made up while we were out, had mini frig and safe. it was great. we walked to almost everything, metro across the street for anything we didn't want to walk to. we only ate the breakfast @ the hotel once, when we had to be out early for our fat tire bike tour to Versailles. it was ok and fairly good price (every thing was HIGH). we ate every other day at Angelenia. great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: charnwoodfield
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from two nights at the Hotel Brighton. The location is superb and the hotel staff were very friendly and did all that was asked. It was my wife's birthday so I purchased a "VIP Welcome pack". It was a bottle of champagne and some of the most lovely flowers that I have ever seen. So lovely that they came home with us on Eurostar and are still blooming in our lounge!! Our room was on the top floor with a small balony that gave fantastic views over Paris. Perhaps some would find the room small by some four star hotel standards and the English language TV channels were limited, but you don't go to Paris to sit in your hotel room and watch TV!! The location, rate and ambience made up for those minor negatives. I would rate our experience here as excellent as we were able to walk to all the major sights and there are plenty of shops, bars and restaurants near by. The downside for we Brits is the shocking state of the pound versus the Euro. It made it quite an expensive stay - but you can't put a price on keeping a lovely wife happy. I would certainly reccomend this hotel. We booked directly with the hotel group via the web and would stay there again without any doubt..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: motherbored
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Brighton is a lovely, charming hotel perfectly located in the heart of Paris. We booked an "apartment" that had a modest-size bedroom, full bath, and separate small living room with a pullout couch. There was plenty of room for all of us throughout our entire stay. This room configuration and size were perfect as we were traveling with our college-age daughter. The room had been recently updated; was clean; and quiet (we had an inside courtyard apt). Our room included two flat-screen TVs, a refrigerator, safe, full bath (with two sinks), tub, shower, separate toilet area, hair dryer, and plenty of closet space. WiFi Internet was available in the room using a prepaid internet card purchased at the front desk. Only nits: Shower was weak and took 10 minutes to get any hot water and cable television went down. The staff was wonderfully helpful and welcoming. Anytime we needed anything, they provided it to us in a friendly, expedient manner: restaurant recommendations, taxi, directions, etc. The hotel is located near EVERYTHING: across the street from the Metro, Tuileries Garden, the Louvre, L'orangerie, and Jeu de Paume museums. Walking distance to great restaurants, bateau mouche, and amazing shopping. Tips: Rue Ste. Honore, one street away, has all the couture shopping anyone would ever need. We enjoyed dining casually at the Imperial Cafe one block away. We also loved Le Souffle (fabulous to have appetizers, entrees and desserts prepared as souffles) and Il Cortile (a fine Italian restaurant located in the Hotel Castille). One last tip: Be sure to purchase a museum card, which is a prepaid advance ticket that gets you into almost all Parisian museums. The card can be purchased for a variety of days and is activated (by writing the date on the back) as soon as you use it the first time. We purchased ours on the afternoon we arrived at the Notre Dame Cathedral, because there is barely a line at the ND ticket booth. If you purchase the card at any of the museums, you'll have to wait on a long, serpentine line. The museum card can be also purchased online (takes 10 days to mail), or at the Paris airports. Once you get the card, you enter all museums via a separate entrance on a short line. Be sure to check your coats--you'll roast in the museums. Be sure to have hot chocolate and a pastry at Angelina's Salon du The, which is located four doors down from the Hotel Brighton on Rue Rivoli--It is unbelievably scrumptious! Be sure to go before 3PM, because the place is a zoo afterwards. Last word of advice: I purchased lovely cookies at Angelina's while in Paris; and, like a good citizen, checked YES "are you bringing any food item into the US?" Well, had I known I would have to stand on an additional customs' line because I had food (cookies). I would have left the yummy treats with the hotel staff. Goodness, Uncle Sam, was that necessary? We really had a great trip, and would go back to Hotel Brighton again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and lovely”
Reviews.Author: Writer/Director
Reviews.Content: The last time we came to Paris we stayed at the Hotel Regina down the street. On this trip, we thought about staying at the Regina again, but opted for the Brighton because it was less expensive, had a better location, and was also a 4-star hotel. We're very glad we made that choice. The Brighton has much better views than the Regina, larger rooms, larger bathrooms, and for a fraction of the cost. My only issue was that the linens were not changed daily and were only changed when I specifically asked. The staff were all friendly and the location is perfect. A concern is that the AC isn't as strong as it could be. It was 40 degrees outside at night and very chilly, but the room was steaming hot (we turned off all the radiators, etc). With the windows open we were able to sleep fine, but I imagine if it were any warmer outside it would've been miserable. Maybe it is fine when it's hot out, but I don't know. Also, when we checked in we stayed in a smaller room the first night on the 5th floor before changing rooms into a De Luxe room on the 2nd floor for the rest of our week. The tiny room at the top had a double bed (like a double size in the USA), but was nice and had a great shower. The larger room had a king-sized bed (two large twins pushed together). Both had stunning views. The hotel breakfast is a little weird and the service is spotty. My advice is to do what we did - skip the hotel breakfast and walk two doors down to Angelina -- the best place for breakfast in town. They also have the most outstanding hot chocolate you'll ever have in your life. Although the service at Angelina is not so hot either, you'll enjoy the atmosphere. (Tip: go early, the Rue de Rivoli is basically empty in the morning and late at night, but crowded with tourists during the day). There are dozens of great places to eat all within walking distance. Actually - everything in Paris seems to be within walking distance of this hotel. It really is the perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What We Wanted!”
Reviews.Author: LadyDero
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, and we wanted a special hotel with a view of the Eiffel Tower. This is exactly what we got. We booked a Prestige Room and had a spectacular view from our balcony! It couldn't have been more romantic. The room was very spacious and clean. The bathroom was large and had two sinks which was very nice when getting ready in the morning. My only complaint was that the bed didn't have the most comfortable mattress. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, making dinner reservations and arranging for taxis. If (when!) we ever return to Paris, we'll definitely stay at the Hotel Brighton.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location!”
Reviews.Author: jokero
Reviews.Content: Can't recommend this hotel strongly enough. We booked a prestige room as we wanted a view - and a view we got. The room was really big by European standards and bathroom brand new and very comfortable (shower & separate bath). With the balcony doors closed we couldn't hear a peep. The reception staff were extremely helpful and attentive. The location of the hotel is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Miss This One!”
Reviews.Author: FeritCiva
Reviews.Content: Ok, I'm used to really small rooms & bathrooms in Paris. This city is really expensive; so normally I rather book some 3* hotel around Chatelet - Les Halles area. This time as I found a good price on Hotel Brighton's own website, I decided to try it. Well it was a perfect choice! Paris had some bad surprises for us as heavy rain on August but even that caused no problem because Louvre Museum was literally across the street, Buddha Bar and other great cafes/restaurants were all around (recommended restaurant: Cafe Roc, a few blocks to Louvre-side). The hotel itself is a basic one (I'd say 3*) but really clean & nice rooms. And most important; the biggest bathroom I've seen in a Paris hotel (we had a superior room). We didn't try the breakfast as it's always pleasure to have your coffee & crossaint on a typical Paris cafe. As an overall experience, this fine hotel is highly recommended for it's unrivaled location, clean & spacey rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience!”
Reviews.Author: VitaDolce
Reviews.Content: I brought a friend to Paris who had never been there before so I was looking for a great location at an affordable price. I had been to Paris before myself and experienced other hotels. Hotel Brighton was a fabulous experience! We stayed in Room 409 which was a prestige room with 2 balconies with a view and a large bathroom. The staff was very helpful and friendly but special kudos to Mohammed! His friendly smile and warm greeting whenever we saw him made us feel known and appreciated. The hotel had a lovely lobby and breakfast room and the rooms and beds were comfortable and clean. The bathroom was spacious! From our balconies we could see the Tuilleries gardens, Eiffel Tower and the Louvre! Every night before we went to sleep we watched the Eiffel Tower sparkle. More importantly, the location was the best! One block from the Metro and in walking distance to museums, shopping and cafes made it easy to get around. It was enjoyable to walk out the door and have so much available to us. For a special treat, a block away is Angelinas - great for breakfast or special desserts and hot chocolate. We also paid a 3 star price for a 4 star hotel. In between a couple of four and five star hotels on that street we got a fabulous experience for an affordable price. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting...”
Reviews.Author: LondonAmy27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as a solo traveller for a single night's stay in August. My first impressions of the hotel were great, the lobby was lovely and the location fantastic. Unfortunately, I found the male member of staff on the front desk to be both abrupt and rather dismissive upon check-in. (When I checked out the following day he also seemed unable/unwilling to tell me where a particular street was located, and it turned out the street was next to the hotel!). I do have only a rudimentary knowledge of french, but use it to the best of my ability, and he was able to speak english so it didn't seem to be a language barrier, only a service one! I was very happy with the size of the room. I was given room 401, which was a large room on the 4th floor with a huge (comparable to other hotels in Paris) bathroom. My room did not have a view but I did pay a discounted rate so I wasn't expecting one! The room and bathroom (on first inspection) also appeared quite clean. The hotel is located literally across the street from Tuilieries metro stop and the gardens, and is surrounded by many lovely shops and cafes, so the location is great and very central. After returning rather late to the hotel after a day of sightseeing, I was about to go to bed and unfortunately noticed the state of the sheets. There were some small bloodstains on the edges of the sheets and several large holes (possibly cigarette burns) in both the upper and lower sheets. When I inspected them more closely the sheets did not look like they had been changed since the last occupant. As by this time I was too tired to deal with the problem, I slept on top of the blankets! This greatly impacted on my enjoyment of the hotel (and obviously my night's sleep). The only other point I would note is that, as a solo female traveller, it would have made the room feel more secure if there was a chain or similar on the door. The lock itself felt quite flimsy. In summary, great location and great first impressions, but the staff and the state of the linen turned me off this hotel completely. I would not stay here again and would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: WearyTraveler-7
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that this hotel was a direct result of research on tripadvisor.com. The location is unbeatable, the staff very helpful and friendly, the rooms are large and beds comfortable. The metro stop (line 1) is across the street. We went there with our two children and stayed in a courtyard apartment and stayed for four nights. Two big rooms, large bathtub, separate shower and two sinks. The kids loved it and so did we. The staff was very good and responsive to all our queries. We had the breakfast at the hotel and it was inline with what we got at other places. There are a couple of cafes just outside which also serve breakfast and coffee if you need. I would definitely recommend this hotel to all who visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible position - you know you are in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: jmlparis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I lived in Paris for two years, so when we go back we usually stay in apartments. This time, we had only two nights so decided to stay in a hotel. The Brighton has been recommended to me and I had inspected it when I lived in Paris, so knew exactly what to expect. It really is one of the best located hotels in Paris for the price. For more than double you can stay at the Meurice only a few doors up and stay in a much smaller room (though admittedly more luxurious). But, remember, you are in Paris - you won't spend all your time in your room! Having said that, our room was huge - big king size bed, large armoire, plenty of space, two windows and a narrow balcony running the entire length of the large room. The bathroom had twin basins, a separate shower and bath, and a separate toilet. I choose a large room with a balcony on the fourth floor to ensure that we would be high enough to see over the trees of the Tuileries and to enjoy the incredible view. And incredible it is -you are opposite the Tuileries Gardens, with Musee D'Orsay in the background - the Louvre to the left, the Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe on the right. We absolutely loved it and you definitely know you are in the heart of Paris at such a fabulous location. We skipped the hotel breakfast and went over to the gardens to have breakfast from the Paul patisserie cart at the Louvre end. They have tables set up with a coffee machine - superb! The staff were very helpful. We had huge amounts of luggage and the porter was great. All very couteous, friendly and welcoming. No negative experiences at all. But, do ask for a high room with a balcony - so much nicer being about to step outside to feel Paris and well as see it. And did I mention the location???? Opposite the Tuileries metro stop, so if you can't walk somewhere, just jump on a metro. Also, there were always plenty of taxis available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: mvtourist
Reviews.Content: I saw a review of this hotel in National Geographic and it looked perfect for a short stay in Paris. I was concerned by the number of comments about the unhelpful staff and decided to risk it seeing as our stay was short. However, I wanted to write a review to say that the staff at this hotel were great. My husband and I and our 5 year old daughter had a very large room with a nice bathroom with separate shower (room 202). The room was very clean and tastefully decorated. The location is amazing - we had no problem getting here on the metro from Gare du Nord. The staff let us check in early and were always very helpful when we asked for restaurant recommendations or directions or needed a taxi. A suggestion - at least try and speak French instead of assuming (probably correctly) that everyone can speak English and I am sure your reception will be very friendly. The nearby Rue St Honere is wonderful for shopping and lots of good restaurants nearby - try Angelinas for sure for breakfast or just an afternoon tea.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abarro
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Hotel Brighton for 4 nights in a junior suite on the 3rd floor with a balcony overlooking the Tulierie Gardens. I would highly recommend a room with a balcony as you can walk onto the balcony (though it is very narrow) and see the Louvre (across the street), Eiffel Tower in the distance and as far as the Arc de Triomphe. We had a very large renovated room that had plenty of space for us and all our luggage. Bathrooms are also newly rated. Though you are overlooking a very busy street, the sound proof windows do a good job of muffling the noise down to a dull roar. There is no lobby, per se, just an area with a small reception desk and a reading room just behind reception. The staff are top notch, courteous and extremely helpful with providing directions to all the sights (Metro is across the road). they also sell the Museum Pass which allows you to bypass the ticket purchasing lines at the various attractions - though you must still wait in the ticket holder line up. I would also recommend buying breakfast at the hotel for 10 Euros as you can eat and drink as much as you want versus buying one croissant and a single coffee at a cafe for the same price. Breakfasts were very good. I would highly recommend this hotel for its location and room conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Very agreeable central stay”
Reviews.Author: sebx
Reviews.Content: The Brighton is decently priced for Paris (I paid EUR 200), clean, bordering on charming and very well located for cultural pursuits. The rooms facing the Rue de Rivoli have a fantastic view (at least in the upper floors): Tuileries, Eiffel tower. If you want to sleep with the windows opened these rooms are naturally noisier as they are facing the road. However, all rooms have air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Brilliant, Brilliantly Simple”
Reviews.Author: Sword1
Reviews.Content: We (two couples) stayed at the Brighton for 2 nights 20/21st June, last weekend. You cannot fault this gem. The location is perfect, just opposite the Jardin des Tuileries and within 5 minutes walk of The Louvre, Concorde & Place Vendome. In addition the metro across the road will take you very quickly to any other destination in Paris. The hotel is basic in amenities so if you need all the bells and whistles then look elsewhere but in terms of having a very comfortable base from which to explore Paris in the knowledge that on your return you can relax in reasonable comfort then the Brighton is perfect. Reception staff are very friendly, attentive and knowledgeable. The rooms while not massive are of a good size with a fine bathroom (double sink) and good size double bed. Better than average storage space is provided along with a free safe in your room. Our room overlooked the courtyard but as we spend little time in our hotel rooms this made no difference to us - if you insist on a view then perhaps ask for a room to the front. Rooms were made up both days and fresh towels provided. My only minor gripe would be that our shower fitting did not attach to the wall (although our friends one did) but this does not detract from the very pleasant experience we had. I would return no problem and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: janice67
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple stayed here for two nights in March 2008. It's location is second to none. Many of the key attractions are within walking distance (eg. Louvre, Musee D'Orsay) and a well-connected Metro station is 2 minutes walk away. Our room was relatively small (often the case in Paris), but clean, comfortable and well-decorated, with all the facilities we needed. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, but the hotel staff gave us complimentary coffees in the lounge while we waited for it to be made up. We didn't eat in the hotel because there are plenty of places for a cheaper breakfast nearby. We had a standard room with no view. For a longer stay it may have been worth upgrading to a high-floor room at the front of the building, but with just three days to explore we decided to spend our time in Paris, not looking at it!

Reviews.Title: “Made a good choice in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chgreen
Reviews.Content: Four of us ladies had a 7 night girls' trip planned to London. We decided to take Eurostar to Paris and spend 3 nights in Paris. In National Geographic Traveler, we found Hotel Brighton listed as a pick in an article. We checked out reviews on traveladviser.com. We were looking for an easy access entrance for our friend who has a mobility scooter. It appeared that Hotel Brighton had this. Location sounded great! Our choice in Hotel Brighton was fantastic!! In reviews before we left, everything was good except service at front desk. We did not find this to be the case. Service up front was great in every way. I do not think there was anyone who would not speak English with us. They did not seem to mind at all to speak English. My roommate and I had standard 2 twin bed room and it was great. It looked out to the front of hotel. Bath was excellent! Both rooms were plenty large. The location was wonderful. We were in walking distance of many of the museums, etc. that we wanted to go to. There, also, was eating and shopping convenience. Tour offices were also close. I will defintely stay at the Hotel Brighton the next time I go to Paris and I will defintely recommend it to other people. Thanks for a wonderful sojourn in Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tammy65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Brighton for our honeymoon and we were located on the 5th floor overlooking the Jardin Tuileries. We couldn't have asked for a better view of Paris, with the Louvre to our left, the Musee D'Orsay straight opposite and the Eiffel tower to the right looking so close it felt like we could touch it. On our first night we walked easily to the Champs Elysee within 15 minutes. The hotel room was lovely and the service from the staff was second to none. All members of staff we met were cheerful and friendly, especially if we attempted to speak French to them. We had the continental breakfast in our room and although I do agree that it is overpriced it was presented beautifully and was exactly what I expected as a continental breakfast having stayed in Paris before. As to location I cannot imagine anywhere better to be in Paris. It was worth every euro of the 220 euros per night we spent because the view was absolutely spectacular both during the day and especially at night. We had a fantastic honeymoon at the Hotel Brighton and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, watch your belongings”
Reviews.Author: jcb4
Reviews.Content: The view is great (if you have a room facing the Tuileries). But watch your belongings. A significant amount of cash disappeared from my bag while stored for an afternoon in their baggage room. Management was less than helpful. Blamed me for leaving cash in the bag. Did not propvide any assistance - like contacting police. Management seems to think stealing is OK if the opportunity is there. A tripadvisor member New York City May 5th, 2008

Reviews.Title: “Clean room with great views”
Reviews.Author: Burdi3
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I recently stayed at this hotel. The hotel is in a great location near the Louvre and the Tuilleries. We were greeted by two hotel desk employees who were very pleasant and helpful. We requested a high floor and two double beds which we received without any problems. The hotel staff was incredibly helpful as they assisted in organizing a private car hire to the Champagne region for the day. The staff made all of the phone calls and even compared prices with a few private car services. My friend and I did a little "price investigating" out on our own and when we returned back to the hotel for the private car hire search results, the staff was able to secure a car that was much cheaper than we could find with a very knowledgeable driver. We definitely enjoyed the hotel. It was incredibly clean. The beds were firm. The bathroom was a decent size. The views of the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlondieA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week and was very pleased with the location, room, service, and staff. Being located directly across the street from the Tuileries, it is within walking distance of many other attractions including the Place de la Concorde, the Louvre, Opera Garnier, and Place Vendome. In addition, it is just a short walk from the Cityrama office, from which our three tours originated. Many shops and cafes are also nearby, including Angelina (which was excellent). The staff were all very friendly and helpful, even writing down metro directions for us to various places we wanted to visit. We had a courtyard view and paid approximately 172.00 euros per night. The room and bathroom were a nice size (especially by European standards) and were decorated in a style comparable to American hotel chains. The only negative thing I can say about the hotel was the pricey cost of the breakfast buffet. At 16 euros per person, one could do better at Angelina or one of the other nearby restaurants. I recommend this hotel, and I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location!”
Reviews.Author: paris27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Brighton from March 13 - 17, 2008. It was a wonderful experience. I had booked a "Prestige Room facing the Tuileries" on their website and had e-mailed them and requested the top floor with a balcony and requested an early arrival check in. They said they couldn't guarantee those things, but would do their best. The hotel had booked a shuttle transfer for me as well. I arrived after my overnight flight from the US and was met outside of customs by the transfer driver. I got to the hotel around 9:00am and my room was ready for me! The guy at the front desk was polite, but not overly friendly. The bell boy who brought my luggage and me to my 4th floor room was fabulous...very cheerful and friendly. The room was amazing....it smelled like it had been recently painted and it was huge! I had 2 small balconies and was on the top floor. To the right I could see the Eiffel Tower...to the left, the Louvre and in front of me were the Tuileries Gardens with the Musee d'Orsay in the distance. I had a separate sitting area with a couch. The bathroom was huge....it had marble countertops and 2 sinks. A very large tub with a separate shower stall, which was also very large. The toilet was in a separate closet within the bathroom. There was a nice little basket of soaps and shampoo and big plush towels on a towel warmer rack. They also had robes for me to use. There were 2 space heaters - one by each window which worked well and they had a knob to adjust the heat or turn it off. The hotel does have air conditioning but is only activated during the summer months. The open windows provided a nice breath of fresh cool air if the room got stuffy. It was cool enough to be comfortable without much heat or air while I was there. The location couldn't have been better. The Tuileries metro stop was across the street, one block down. This is the yellow "liine 1" which gave easy access to all of Paris. The Tuileries garden entrance was just across the Rue de Rivoli. Walk to the left and you could visit the Louvre. Walk straight ahead and head towards the river and the Musee d"Orsay across the river. You could walk to the right to the Place de la Concorde and the Champs Elysees and Arc de Triomphe in the distance. I didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, so I cannot comment on that. I'm not a big breakfast eater and had read that it was too expensive (from other Trip Advisor travelers) so I didn't add their breakfast to my package. There were plenty of places nearby to get a croissant or pan au chocoalte. There was even a McDonald's a few blocks down towards the Louvre. (their idea of Pancakes and mine are not the same! lol) I loved the location, the room, the amenities, the view! The people at the front desk weren't rude, but they weren't overly friendly. They spoke English and were always helpful when I needed something, so that was good enough for me. It's amazing to see the Eiffel Tower lit up at night from your room. Every hour, on the hour, for 10 minutes it sparkles all over...very cool! Feel free to contact me if you have any questions. I've added some photos from my visit here.

Reviews.Title: “4-star location, 1-star service”
Reviews.Author: Famcruise
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my family based on a recommendation in National Geographic Traveler. I agree that the location is fun and practical if you prefer the Right Bank. The rooms are also adequate and quite roomy by Parisian standards. The service, by contrast, was dreadful. A young blond woman was at the reception when we arrived in the afternoon of March 15; she shoved a form in our face as if she were a bureaucrat in the French Social Security Office. She was equally unfriendly and unhelpful the next day, though she had enough time to snicker and giggle on the phone during what appeared to be a social call with friends. A man named Elio was similarly hostile to us and to other guests. We could barely get anyone at the hotel to make a restaurant reservation. We had no hot water at sporadic points throughout our 4-day stay; although the hotel sent an apology bottle of champagne, they never fixed the problem. Most 4-star hotels in Paris have a concierge, or at least top-notch front-desk staff. This one was a service disaster. I also find the Rue de Rivoli area a bit cold and commercial, though that's of course not the hotel's fault. You can do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisH3040
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located directly across the street from the Jardin des Tuileries. It is one block from the Louvre and close enough to walk the Champs Elysees. We were greeted with a bottle of champagne and anniversary wishes upon our arrival, along with a fantastic view of the Louvre, the Jardin des Tuileries and the Eiffel Tower. Our corner room on the top floor was HUGE. Most rooms in Paris seemingly have no room to even turn around. This spacious room was accompanied by a king size bed, a sofa, table and chairs as well as a large bathroom with a shower, a tub, full sink and seperate toilet. An in-room safe and balcony added a touch of charm to an already wonderful room. The staff was extremely helpful in recommending fantastic, nearby restaurants and securing reservations in the hard to get ones.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: cathersm
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel last week. What a fab location! We had a 'tuleries room' over the gardens on the 2nd floor, with panaramic views from the lovre on the left to the eiffel tower on the right. The room had been recently refurbished with huge, immaculate bathroom, massive shower cubicle and seperate bath tub, and double sinks. The room was tastefully french in style with antique furnishings. Could not fault the room and certainly the largest I've stayed in whilst in Paris! The breakfast at 10-16 euro a day was dissapointing, poor choice and not that appetising. For the same money or less we then went a couple of doors down to Angelinas which was the business. The staff were fine - some came across as a little stand offish, but all our needs were met adequately. Would definately stay there again but go out for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: IveG0tTheTravelBug
Reviews.Content: Hotel Brighton is centrally located in the first arrondissement in Paris. The Tuilleries Gardens and the Louvre are across the street and the Place Vendome and Madeleine Church are only a few blocks away. The Tuilleries metro stop is one block away. Our room was newly renovated, clean, and well decorated. While our room was small (approx. 14' x 14') it has been my experience that this is fairly standard in major European cities. The bathroom was also newly renovated and spacious. However, we did not like the shower which was only an open bath tub (i.e. no shower curtain or glass doors) with a hand held sprayer that was located on the faucet set at tub height. It was a nice tub for a bath though! The view outside our two sets of french doors (one in the bathroom and one in the bedroom) was of the Tuilleries and the Louvre. Staff at the front desk is friendly though not extremely helpful - I think mostly due to the language barrier (I only speak a few words of French). Breakfast at the hotel is basic and we preferred going to nearby restaurants instead. Overall we were happy with our stay and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: Jeske
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, excellent breakfast buffet, fantastic location, clean, comfortable and spacious room (ours was a 'superior double'). Our room faced the courtyard so it was very quiet and we slept with the window open and didn't hear a noise. If you want great views over the Eiffel Tower and the Jardin Tuileries then ask for a room facing the Rue de Rivoli but it may be a bit noisy if you sleep with the window open. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely recommend to friends!”
Reviews.Author: jastill
Reviews.Content: For the tourist this hotel has everything you need - comfortable beds, extremely clean and large (room 316) bathrooms and a terrific location - the Meurice is a few doors up and the Westin just a few more. With metro station Tuileries across the road and Concorde just up the street you can't go wrong. The standard rooms are not large but remember you are in Paris....why stay in your hotel room when there is so much more to do! Try the best hot chocolate ever at Angelina just a few doors up from this great hotel. PS - I really liked the staff who were very helpful with booking our Moulin Rouge tickets and storing our luggage whilst we shopped, shopped, shopped at the SOLDES!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nasty staff”
Reviews.Author: sophieakkg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Brighton with my parents, sister, cousin and husband (yes, we were a big party) this summer. The location was perfect, and the rooms were clean and gorgeous. However, the staff was incredibly rude. My husband and I were actually yelled by the front desk clerk at one point when we were having coffee in the lobby because their lobby was not "a picnic room". Additionally, even though we told them well in advance how many people there would be, they did not book enough beds. After much trouble, they got my sister a tiny little cot, which barely fit into one of the rooms (did I mention the rooms were a little small?). The breakfast in the morning was terrible. Go to Cafe Angelina a couple west of the hotel instead for heavenly food.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay near the Louvre and Musee d'Orsay”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaElizabeth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed staying at the Hotel Brighton in November 2007. We stayed there our first 2 nights of our first stay in Paris and loved the views of the Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, and Tuilleries from our 4th floor Tuilleries room. The room was large, clean, and comfortable, and we got a discount through the esprit-de-france website. My husband had some trouble sleeping with the constant Rue de Rivoli noise below, but I didn't have trouble since it was more of a low rumble. When we returned to the Brighton at the end of our trip, we stayed in a courtyard room to avoid the noise. The room was smaller but extremely quiet (no views, of course). During our second stay at the end of November, we were surprised to see that the smog would have obscured the Eiffel Tower views from the Tuilleries rooms. I hadn't even thought of that possibility. Since the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, and Orangerie are all a short walk across the Tuilleries, this place was a great location for us. It was about 20-25 minutes to the amazing Notre Dame and Sainte-Chapelle stained glass, 10 minutes to the Garnier Opera House, and about 45 minutes to the Arc de Triomphe. We would definitely stay here again. Also, the 10 euro continental breakfast was good and not expensive by Paris standards (although I would recommend a trip to Angelina's a few doors down on a splurge for the great hot chocolate and pastries).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a bit on the tatty side..............”
Reviews.Author: Dezzydez
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for its proximity to Tuilieres. Booked direct through the Esprit de France hotel group website which was a relatively painless and easy process. However forgot to expressly request a high floor so got given a 1st floor Tuileres facing room with a pretty limited view..waste of the extra premium paid. The hotel itself is ok by Paris standards, (I'm talking Paris standards here), so the rates are quite good value for the central location (again this is by Paris standards!) Its a very french affair, typical french service standards, clean enough, basic bathroom, average sized room. Our room had high ceilings and nice top to bottom french door windows. The furniture was very old and about to fall apart. Our big antique wardrobe had a broken door and was nailed in, so absolutely useless.
