Very charming and quirky for the tourists but I want to hang my clothes! Good hotel if you need to stay somewhere central, its dependable and reasonably priced so will probably stay here again. Good shopping to be had at the back on Rue St Honore, nice food at Cafe Ruc, loads of Japanese restaurants a 7 min walk away near the "Japan Town" towards Opera and a little gem of a restaurant around the corner in Rue Thabon - L'ardroise. Its very popular so book in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brighton-Pure Perfection-AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: SJ*HL*S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our second stay at the Brighton, and again, it was incredible! We emailed the property to book, requesting the same type room as before, Tuileries View Room. I had remembered staying on the 5th floor, so this is what we requested. We arrived in Paris at 11:00 AM, were very pleased to see our room was ready. However, upon checking into room 512, it was NOTHING like the previous stay. The room was tiny, balcony barely had room for one person and the furnishings were very old. Immediately disappointed, I remembered we had photos from our last stay on our laptop. We took it down to the desk and showed the difference. Bernard looked at the photo, informed me this was room 412 and gave us the key to it instead!! What incredible service!! As before, the view incredible, prime location, and priced to make us smile!! We'll certainly be returning yet again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: yensta
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, and located almost directly opposite the Louvre so you can walk everywhere. The staff were friendly and polite, and the room was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: wendydethame
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Paris, where we stayed at the Hotel Brighton. We stayed here because our friends were staying up the road but their hotel was fully booked. This hotel was cheaper and not with the same rating as our friends, but the room was bigger and we had an amazing view. The room was very large, with a lovely modern renovated bathroom. We had a tiny balcony but we could see the Eiffel Tower as well as the Louvre from it. The staff were friendly and spoke very good English, they were able to answer all the questions we had. I would highly recommend this hotel and will be staying here again should I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “what a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: hobbitsky
Reviews.Content: My sister and I found this hotel delightful. We had a room on the top floor overlooking Paris in all its splendour. Wonderful view. The room was quite spacious with two balconies and was clean and serviced well. The staff were courteous if a little stand offish. The breakfast was mediocre and not worth the price.. We were charged E32 for breakfasts we did not have. However, this was refunded immediately once bought to the attention of the manager. Tour bookings could be made a few doors down at the local agencies which was convenient The hotel is within easy walking distance of most attractions. Restaurants in the Rue de Rivoli are expensive and we found one block away a little grocery store which stocked everything. Restaurants abound aplenty in the area so look around for one that suits you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Scoobydoo13
Reviews.Content: We booked a special balcony package at the Hotel Brighton for the final stage of the Tour de France. The hotel is in an excellent location and the route went right past the front door. It is situated opposite the Jardin de Tuilliere and the Louvre and the views over Paris are amazing. Our room itself was very small with a little balcony just big enough for two of us to stand on. It was on the top floor though which meant spectacular views. The room was clean and we didn't worry about the size as it is just somewhere to sleep and we weren't planning on spending too much time in there. The staff on the front desk were always friendly and helpful and we were able to check in early when we arrived. They were also happy to look after our luggage after we had checked out to save us lugging it round with us. One small complaint would be that the buffet breakfast was not great. Both mornings we were there they had completely run out of orange juice and even though people asked for it, it didn't get re-filled. There was also a fairly limited choice of what to eat and again it seemed that when something from the buffet had run out, it didn't seem to get replaced very quickly so on the first morning there was quite a lack of food. Overall though we enjoyed staying at this hotel as it was right in the centre of Paris and was easy to get to everywhere. It was a really enjoyable weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Skytop82
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Brighton. Fortunately, we were able to stay in room 308, a large room with two small balconies overlooking the Tuileries gardens, the Eiffel tower, and the Louvre. The bathroom was spacious with a separate tub, shower, and two sinks. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were especially impressed with Cynthia, Bernard, and Gerhard. We also appreciated the complimentary copies of the International Herald Tribune. As I have read reviews of other hotels in Paris and as we talked with other tourists in Paris and heard their stories about broken toilet seats, no hot water, mysterioius annoying noises, etc., I was all the more grateful for Hotel Brighton. It was a wonderful place to stay. We also enjoyed the Angelina restaurant for lunch which is just a block away. It was a classy place with reasonable prices, and we liked L'Imperial which was also just a short walk up the Rue de Rivoli and seemed a cut above some of the other places on the street. Our experience at these two places was far better than at Cafe de Flore on the Left Bank which turned out to be a disappointment. Another plus of the Hotel Brighton was that Paris Vision and and Gray Line (Cityrama) are just a few doors away which made it convenient for some excursions we wanted to take.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the views, bring an earplug”
Reviews.Author: kauailover11
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location. Does not get better than this. The Louvre to your left, the Tuileries gardens bang in front of you and the sparkling Eiffel tower to your right. Rue Saint Honore and the Vendome is only 2 minutes away. 5 minutes walking to the Opera. Very romantic. Our room had been recently renovated and was spotlessly clean. We loved talking to the smiling and sweet Jean Luc the concierge/breakfast server/ front desk. You would need an earplug to stay in this hotel since it is on one of the busiest roads in Paris, but that is how you get the views. We always bring earplugs on holidays (for the airplanes) so this was not a problem for us. Besides, how many hotels in Paris are that quiet anyway? Come here and reserve the Tuileries rooms and you will not be disappointed. A third of what you'd pay at the Meurice hotel a few steps away. (The lunch at the Le Jardin d'Hiver is magnificent by the way@the Meurice)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: F1Macca
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location close to all the shops and major tourist attractions, it is clean and of a high standard and we found the staff very friendly. The buffet breakfast was excellent and was served until 11 AM which means you aren't in a rush to get up in the morning if you don't want to. We couldn't fault it at all and wouldn't hesitate to go back or recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locations, Good Price, Room only OK.”
Reviews.Author: DavidBahamas
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights with wife and 2 young children and had a great trip. As mentioned by all reviewers the location is perfect. We booked a suit with view but as the room was on the first floor there really was no view which, as this was my wife's first trip to Paris was a big disapointment. The hotel were willing to move us but the alternative room was only available for one night. We found the staff helpful and friendly but housekeeping was poor. One day we noticed that dirty towels had been hung back up in the bathroom (I just collected new ones from reception). We did not eat in hotel and found area restaurants very good although the ones on the Rue De Rivoli obviously price according to their location but we were never 'ripped of', at least I didn't notice if we were. Paris really is incredible and I would recommend that all visitors don't sweat the small stuff and just savour one of the world's great cities. On our last day we walked back from Left Bank and bumped into Karl Lagerfeld directing a fashion shoot on the bridge. There was only a few people watching and nobody seemed too bothered (nobody except my wife that is). It was a perfect end to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: NZder
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't have a better location and oh so Paris! You are almost on top of the Louvre and over look the gardens. Near the best shops, restaurants and the Metro (but no need to use that!). We wandered around the best part of Paris and felt like we were right in the middle of it all. Double glazing stops any noise. The furnishings are extravagant and very comfortable. The bathroom was huge as was the room. Friendly staff. Would not bother with breakfast as it is nice to wander to a cafe and get a coffee etc which will be far cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a first Paris visit”
Reviews.Author: IyerRochester_NY
Reviews.Content: We booked nearly five months ahead. Specifically asked for e renovated room with good views- as advised by others in this forum. We arrived around 10:30 am, really tired. Expected to be told that we could not check in yet, but they asked us to wait in the lounge for 15 minutes while getting the room ready. Offered us coffee. We had a Junior suite on the fourth floor, with a very narrow balcony (single file standing!). Wonderful view- Eiffel tower, Jardin de Toulieres, Louvre, Orsay, National assembly building. That night there were fireworks near Eiffel, we had a balcony seat! Never tired of watching the Eiffel tower at night. Clean room, one queen bed and a sofa bed. Rather thin, but clean carpet. Furniture looked good, not "chain hotel" type. Some ill fitting drawers. Large bathroom and separate toilet (but no place to wash hands in toilet). A separate shower. Difficult to keep the shower head up properly, the wall fitting was not strong enough. But on the whole, very adequate. Noise from street can be bothersome, but very tolerable if you can use earplugs at night. Hotel staff were courteous. However, they had trouble calling in restaurant reservations- forgot twice! Have to pay for Internet access. This hotel is very convenient for the main tourist attractions and sits near some very expensive hotels. I recommend this hotel for a first time visit to Paris, one can walk to all the attractions. Avoid the nearby cafes, venture out a little. The nearby Marche st-Honore square has a bakery, good cafes, a laundromat.

Reviews.Title: “Milestone birthday with a view”
Reviews.Author: Beetleman
Reviews.Content: I booked the room for my other half's 40th birthday as his requirements were a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower. We splurged and took the junior suite although a few weeks before we left I discovered they had a special deal going (July is slow for Paris I believe) and I was able to get the normally 255 Euro room for 224 Euros which included buffet breakfast for both of us everyday. They told us that we had one of the best rooms in the house and it was quite spectacular. A very large room with a sitting area that included a couch and chairs and a large king-sized (American standards) bed. The view of the Tuilleries, Musee d'Orsay, Eiffel Tower and even the ferris wheel in the Tuilleries made this room spectacular. We had four balconies, two with views and the other two with views of a side street - but the balcony wrapped around the entire suite. We had room 308 (previously mentioned) by the way. Be warned that you can't really sit on the balconies (they're narrow and a little disconcerting if you have fear of heights) but they are spectacular to watch the city go by. Although Rue du Rivoli is a busy street the double-doors masked the noise of the street pretty well. And air conditioning was good although the European hotel concept of leaving your key in the little slot by the door for electricity was new to this trip. The staff was friendly and excellent. Those who don't speak French need not worry as their English is excellent although please use a "Bon Jour" and a "Merci" occasionally. The breakfast was good since it was included - toast, croissants, jams, jelly, fruit, ham, juices, coffee. I would not have paid 16 Euros each for it however. The location is very good as you are a walk (sometimes a longer one - 20 minutes) to almost everything. And the Tuilleries metro stop is across the street. The overall experience was fantastic and memorable and the perfect way for my other half to celebrate his birthday. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: vegiegirl_7
Reviews.Content: My family of four (two children aged 10 and 14) stayed at the Brighton for 5 nights in mid July and were very happy with the hotel. It was smaller than I'd imagined but that was not a problem at all. As mentioned in previous reviews, Bernard on the front desk is a wonderful conceirge - very professional and super polite and helpfull with excellent English. If you have any problems, he is only too happy to help. Our room (a junior suite) was lovely but did have a couple of downsides. My husband and I had a king size bed (very comfortable) and I had planned on the children sleeping on the sofa bed, however, it was much too small for both of them so my teenage son had the sofa bed (which creaked during the night every time he turned over) and my daughter slept on the big cushion of the sofa bed down on the floor with a few additional cushions and pillows. We asked for more sheets to make up the bed for her which were brought up quickly and she slept there happily for the duration of our stay. The main problem was the traffic noise. It seems that either there's an awful lot of crime in Paris or the local police just like to use their sirens when they get bored. There were sirens sounding much of the night which were intermingled with the screams coming from one of the rides on the Jardin De Tuileries' Fair which just happened to be located across the road directly in front of the hotel for the months of July and August. However, the flip side of all this noise is the fantastic view. Maybe take ear plugs? We had the continental breakfast in the hotel a couple of mornings for 10 euros each which is similar to most of the prices in the cafes very close by (between 10 and 15 euros) but if you go back a few streets, you can get the same breakfast for 7 euros each. The location is excellent, we walked to the Louvre (very close by and part of the wonderful view if you're overlooking the Jardin De Tuileries), the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame - in fact, we went everywhere on foot. The only time we used transport was to go on the Paris Vision tour bus to Disneyland Park - personally I wouldn't bother with Disneyland simply because of the horrendous queues. We had to queue for 40 minutes just to buy some sun screen when we first got in (only place selling it was the same place that hires out wheel chairs and push chairs - hence the long waiting line). Average waiting queues at the rides were at least half an hour for each short ride and on a hot day with little to no shade, the novelty wears off pretty quickly. My 10 year old daughter actually said she preferred the noisy fair across the road from our hotel to Disneyland!!! - It was a lot cheaper too. If you're looking for souvenirs, you won't be dissapointed -there are a huge number of souvenir shops very close by. There is also one of the new bike hire stations just down the road (the sort where you pick up a bike in one station and can drop it off at another station if desired) so if you feel like cycling around Paris, the bikes are virtually on your doorstep. Overall we had a lovely stay at the Brighton.

Reviews.Title: “The Brighton was one of the best things about our Paris trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: gnatty
Reviews.Content: Great Service & Location, Location, Location!!! If you want an above-average hotel in a super convenient spot in Paris, you should definately consider staying here. I booked this hotel in Jan 06 for a trip to take place that July. I based my decision on the reviews, and mostly the location. I thought it would be great to be able to walk to the Louvre, and to all the best shopping, as well as the river- and it was! I booked a triple room for our 3 kids, and a double room for my husband and I. I had requested a balcony in my booking, but was given a nice, but interior room. Our kids' room was very spacious with a huge marble bathroom, and they loved it. When I went to the desk to ask about the balcony, they said it wasn't in their booking, but they would do their best to get us a balcony room- which they did. They were very friendly and eager to please or help us in any way. Since we had found out that the Tour de France was that weekend, we asked them where we could see it. They told us very matter-of-factly that the Tour would pass directly in front of the hotel-- 7 times!!! We couldn't believe our incredible luck!!! My husband and kids were jumping for joy. Then we realized we could have a perfect overhead view from our 4th floor balcony of the whole street, then go down in front of the lobby and see the riders up close. It was a day none of will ever forget. The other people on the street watched us very jealously as we went up- then down for every oother lap. SOmeone said, "You must have paid a fortune for that room" I told him I actually paid the normal rate, and found the hotel on the "Budget Europe" website! He said, "Do you know who is in the balcony next-door to you?.....The royal family of Luxenburg!" Wow, we did feel like royalty at that point. Aside from the tour mania, and the cool parade which preceeded it, we had the carnival going on across the street in the beautiful park- a stone's throw from the balcony. The huge lit-up ferris wheel was magical at night, and we strolled over and had a few rides from which we could see all of Paris. OH! I can't leave out the wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower from our room also!! Overall, I have to admit that this hotel was one of the best things about our Paris trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: hitoharu
Reviews.Content: My room was dim in the mezzanine. Stopping the key and the bath was broken. However, they were not mended. There was a day from which the hot water did not come out either. The bath towel used hung to the rack as it was occasionally. It cannot be thought very three Ts-star. It never stays at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “View, Price Location, and Service, this is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: lostonline
Reviews.Content: My mother and I traveled to Paris this spring for five nights. It was her first time to Paris and the only requirement she gave me when arranging the trip was that she wanted to stay in a hotel with a view of the eiffel tower from her window for at least one night. I searched trip advisor and came across Hotel Brighton and made contact with the hotel via their own website (Espirit or something similar). I ended up booking all five nights with Hotel Brighton because there was a discount if you booked online mon-wed. I was very specific in my communications, making sure to get the discounted rate, a twin room with a view on a higher floor. Booking with Hotel Brighton was one of the smartest travel decisions I have ever made (and I travel a lot). Here are the specifics: - The room was wonderful. Everything was clearly new and there was more than enough space for my mother and I. Three closets. W/C separate from bathroom (although the shower was hand held and very annoying). There was a lounge/couch in the entry room (salarium?). Flat screen tv (although there was a scratch across the entire screen, only a few channels worked, and there were no english channels, so we just watched music videos in the morning). The bedroom had a desk and two twin beds that were just pushed together, i think they use the room either as a king (make it as one bed) or twin (make it as two) depending what you request. I thought it was room 504, but looking through the other reviews again, it may have been 514. Noise wasn't really a problem. Our room was so high up, you only heard things when the windows were open. We received exactly what we booked/requested. The final bill charged the full rate for one night. and they gladly fixed that at check out. - The view had everything. There was a small balcony for room for two of us to stand, though you feel like you are standing on a window sill. It is quite safe. To the left is the Louvre and its pyramid and you can just make out the top of Notre Dame over it. Beneath you are the Louvre gardens and Tuillerie gardens. Across the gardens is the Musee d'Orsay and some more key landmarks. To your right is the Eiffel Tower. It feels a bit far and small, but it i would rather the view that had everything in a great location than a hotel far out of the way. The view at twilight during the first eiffel tower light shows were unbeleivable. - The staff. I had read pleasant reviews about Bernard on here, but really, he knows his stuff. He was amazing. When we walked in, he greeted us by name and in english. He always kept on top of everything. We booked a tour online before we left, however when we got to Paris and Bernard checked on it, they had no record of us. Bernard sorted the whole thing out! When we were getting picked up early in the morning, Bernard arranged a special breakfast for us. He made recommendations and was always very nice to us. He even offered us an umbrella as it started to rain. The only thing he asks of you, if you enjoy your stay, pass the word on. The rest of the staff is a little hit or miss, but it feels like Bernard is always there (and he leaves notes for the rest of them reminding them to do things). All of the front desk staff speak english and will take care of your needs, albeit occasionally reluctantly. They will book tours, sell you tickets, and make most reservations for you, but don't expect a discount. They will book whatever you want, but will push the companies they have deals with first. This can have pluses and minuses. We let them book the shuttle back to the airport with the company they have a deal with instead of the one we originally picked because they offered a better price, but the shuttle was nothing but a problem. They wanted to arrange it for 2 and a half hours before her flight, but my mother was a little nervous and instead requested pick up almost four hours before her flight. The shuttle was over a half hour late picking her up, and then made another hour's worth of stops picking up travelers before heading towards the airport. The driver dropped her off last at the airport and no where near where she had to check in and did not help her at all with her two large suitcases and two carry-ons. By the time my mother got to the huge check-in line, it was less than an hour till her flight time. In the end she was rushed through check-in and security and had to run through the airport to her gate. This was a lot of unnecessary stress. - The cost. The rate I got 155 euros I think, which went down to 138 with discount, which was more than competitive. I compared it against all of the other hotels in the area and with a view. It definitely beat them. Sure, you could get a room cheaper in another part of town, but I felt like this was a bit of luxury and i was paying for the view. I didn't expect to get a great room too! Beware of all the add-ons though. Breakfast is very pricey, get it at a cafe down the street instead. The internet is available on a computer in the lounge, but it is pricey. four or five euros for 45 minutes I think. As the hotel is finishing up renovations (we saw no sign of any) and getting quite popular, I have a feeling the price may start to rise. They have another hotel a few blocks away that already costs more, and the clientel at this hotel seemed very upscale. I occasionally felt a little out of place as my mother and I would walk through the lobby in our jeans, sneaker and windbreakers going out for a day of sightseeing. Business men and women were checking in as were very posh and sophisticated guests. But I must say that we were never treated any differently. We were always treated as if we were important guests. - The Location can't be beat. You can walk everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: JazzWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Brighton the last week of May in 2007. Part of the reason for choosing the hotel was our research on TripAdvisor with the many positive reviews. I can report the that the reviews were accurate, and we were glad we chose this hotel for our time in Paris. We made the reservation online directly with the hotel, which provides a discount for booking three or more nights. The hotel also does not charge your credit card until after your stay. We booked a junior suite with a Tuilleries view, which we thought was extremely reasonably priced. We received an email confirmation, and then we called two weeks prior to arrival to confirm our room requests, including an early check-in. When we arrived directly from CDG airport around noon (after traveling overnight from Toronto), we were prepared to wait until the room was available; but we were delighted to learn that the reservaton was in order and that our room was ready. My wife and I are often picky with hotel rooms, asking to see a number of them before settling on one. In this case, we accepted the first room we were shown: the room was enormous by Parisian standards with two step-out balconies facing the garden. And yes, the view is what makes the room. There was also ample closet space, an in-room safe, and a huge bathroom with a separate soaking tub and a glass-doored shower. My wife especially enjoyed soaking in the deep tub at the end of a day after long walks throughout the city. The room was clean and tasteful, with two twin beds joined together as a double, a writing desk, a lighted vanity, and a sofa. The noise from the street is, as other guests have mentioned, noticeable. But my wife, who is a light sleeper, brought along earplugs; and she did not have trouble with the street noise. The heavy curtains also helped to keep the noise out. We thought the view was worth the street noise--and it is all that the others have said: you can step out on your balcony and take in the entire city, from the Eiffel Tower to Notre Dame. The greenery from the garden across the street is especially appealing. As far as the service of the hotel is concerned, we have only good things to report: the desk staff was helpful, especially Bernhard, and the breakfast was fine (we ate the breakfast at the hotel only on the last day, because we found it convenient before heading to the train station). Notably, the staff provided excellent advise on traveling to the train station, collected our bags, hailed a cab in the rain, and loaded our luggage. We have nothing but pleasant memories of our stay at the Hotel Brighton. The Tuilleries metro stop is nearby (featured in the recent movie, Paris, Je T'aime), and we enjoyed going to two nearby restaurants: Angelina Salon de The and Cafe Marly. Angelina's is just a few doors down, which is famous for its dark hot chocolate. It is worth the experience, even if the chocolate is over the top. We found other items on the menu were great for lunch, such as the salads and quiche. If you plan to visit the Louvre, we recommend having breakfast at Cafe Marly, an elegant cafe in easy walking distance, right under the arches of the Louvre. Have a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to Everything”
Reviews.Author: mc423
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in a great central location. We were very happy with our stay there. The hotel is clean and the staff were friendly. With three days, we were able to walk the length of Paris from here . We had a superior room which was roomy, with no view, which was fine with me, since there may be some traffic noise in the front rooms overlooking the Tuilleries Gardens. The area is a little dead at night, since it is a tourist strip, but you can cab to the livelier areas. Some of the Paris tour groups are based down the block which was also convenient. They offer a nice continental breakfast (10 euros) or more for eggs etc. No need for other food with restaurants nearby. Warning...stay away from L'Imperial restaurant down the block. Hotel recommends it, but we were ripped off there for drinks. There's a great Irish pub around the corner which I wish I had went to instead. Can't beat the price for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Solibus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Brighton from May 5 to May 20.I had a junior suite on the third floor facing le Jardin des Tuileries.The view was great.The location is perfect.The room was clean and quiet with a lot of space. The staff was polite and very helpful.The breakfast was not that great for 16 euros but nothing is perfect. I recommend this hotel at that price.An excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: debjen321
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Paris, we stayed at the Brighton! The location of the hotel is absolutely perfect. Room 314 was a large suite with a balcony. The views were awesome. Metro station close by. People were friendly. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel. We paid 224 euros, what a deal!!! We hope to go back some day!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brighton view? Priceless!”
Reviews.Author: Bostonpie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our Paris trip with our 2 sons (ages 9 and 12) over their school vacation. Wanted to take a minute to confirm all the great reviews of the Hotel Brighton. We had The View, and it was as amazing as previously stated in every way. The best surprise, one that I hadn't expected, was actually seeing the sparkling Eiffel Tower from our bed! It never stopped being beautiful to look at and the entire family looked forward to it every night, every hour, that we were in the room at the right time. It NEVER got old. The room was large enough for 4 and the bathroom huge, clean and new. Our boys slept on the sofa bed, and if I had one complaint, it was that the sofa bed springs were extremely noisy, and we have boys who move in their sleep. I did mention it to the front desk (it was that bad) but I don't think there was anything they could do about it. Speaking of the front desk, we were treated with nothing but kindness and helpfullness there. The hotel really projects a small hotel feeling, and after a short while, it felt like they knew us. Two things to be aware of: 1) You trade an incredible location and view for a non-neighborhoody venue; i.e. you will not find a corner store on the corner. and 2) The cafes on the Rue de Rivoli mostly cater to tourists and are outrageously overpriced. My husband ordered a beer, albeit a large one, without looking at the price on the menu. Turned out to cost $27, more than my $20 chicken dinner!!! We learned quickly, but painfully, to walk a few blocks or more away to have dinner or breakfast if we were eating in the neighborhood. Hope you enjoy your stay, Paris is incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CAJudy
Reviews.Content: This is a great, centrally-located hotel in Paris. I had a Tuileries room with views of the gardens, Eiffel Tower, Louvre and Musee D'Orsay. It was wonderful. If you are a light sleeper, you may prefer a courtyard room, but I would suggest wearing earplugs and having the fantastic view. The room was clean and the bath was exceptionally clean and modern. Nothing luxurious about the room other than the million dollar view, but at the price I wasn't expecting the Taj Mahal. The continental breakfast at 10 euros was a steal and very good. The staff was pleasant and efficient. I definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view”
Reviews.Author: DaveTravel
Reviews.Content: The views and location is what sold us on this hotel. I read the reviews and as you can see from what people are saying this hotel is a nice place to stay. We booked from the web site with a price of just over $200 a night. We had the view of all the major attractions in Paris, Louvre, Jardin de Tuileries, Arch de Triomphe and the Tour Eiffel. The hotel is only one block from the Metro station, easy for getting around. The one concern that comes with the view is the noise. R. de Rivoli is a very busy street, with the weather being perfect I thought that we could sleep with the balcony doors open. That did not last long, cars going by all night. The room does have air condition but it didn't get cool enough. Not a deal breaker but some concern. The bathroom had a tub and seperate shower. A flat screen tv. The staff was helpful, we only know a little Frech. The front desk clerk told us of a nice resturant nearby L' Imperial, they spoke English. For the area and the price this was a great place to stay. One block down there is another hotel that charges over $500 a night. For what you get at this hotel, we made the right choice by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Bath, Location and Views as promised”
Reviews.Author: More-trips
Reviews.Content: Our party had rooms 312 looking out on the "view" and room 102 on the "courtyard". Both rooms were junior suites. They were huge by any measure. Double sink baths were extremely nice with separate tub and shower and toilet in different closet. (In 312, the toilet was separate location from rest of bath) Great water pressure in the shower and nice large soaking tub, which can feel great after a long day of walking. The location was superb! The views just as you see on this site from candid photos. The couryard view was just looking out over the tops of some buildings below, but we really were not there that often, so it didn't matter for that room. They have two elevators - one tiny and one very suitable size. Only have two minor complaints: one is that there was no clock in the room, and the other is that the desk staff was not friendly or helpful to us. Unfortunately, Bernard, (who others have mentioned here and who was very helpful in my email communications prior to arrival) was on holiday during our stay. Despite my attempts at being very friendly and trying my best with my limited french, I was disappointed at how unhelpful they were. When we arrived, one of the rooms was not made up for the third person. I called down and the guy brought up sheets, but we had to make the bed ourselves. He explained that he was alone at the desk during that time. We also asked the location of the nearest bank and they couldn't tell us. Maybe we just caught them at an off time. I could certainly recommend this hotel for all the other positives as stated.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: mojoholly
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous location for an excellent price. It is a simple hotel, but the rooms are large and the views are wonderful. We could see the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower, the Tuilleries Garden, and the Crystal Palace from our window. The only negative is that there is very limited room service, but there are so many wonderful bakeries and cafes within a couple of blocks that that's not a problem. If you need coffee or tea in your room, just be sure to take a little hot pot and tea bags or coffee bags with you. Also, don't trust the front desk to give you correct information. They told us that Versailles closed at 7:00, and gave us wrong directions to the train station. After an hour of walking and riding the train, we arrived at 4:00 to find out that it actually closed at 5:30, and there was a 45 minute wait to enter. Overall, this is a great little place for the money, and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Tired Decor”
Reviews.Author: Bridgit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Brighton last November with two friends. While the location was wonderful, our room was not. The room was large but very sparsely furnished (two single beds, a cot, a desk and a mini-fridge with a TV perched on top). The paint was peeling from the walls and the bedspreads looked less than clean. The bathroom had tiles missing, a burned out light bulb and more peeling paint. It was not a room that you would want to spend any time in other than to sleep. The room was extremely noisy at night from the busy street below. The one plus is that the concierge was great. Very friendly and offered good suggestions for restaurants, sites etc.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular views, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: OldKeys
Reviews.Content: Unforgettable stay. Can confirm other positive reviews. Stunning view of the Tuilleries and Eiffel Tower. Minutes walk from the Louvre. Very reasonable rates considering the location and views. Very attractive room/decor, beamed ceiling, flat screen TV. Breakfast is not included in the rate so there is no need to take it in the hotel. We tried it one day and it was average but as good as some of the nearby restaurants/cafes. One drawback, no tea or coffee making factilies in the room - have to go out for hot drinks. But overall, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “brighton hotel best value in area”
Reviews.Author: LANABrisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Brighton hotel and had a very spacious room overlooking the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre, they were renovating at the time but that was no problem, I have stayed at the Brighton hotel once before and had a lovely room then, when we read the terrible review from the Melbourne family dated the 11th july 2005 I thought they were discribing another hotel The reception people are very helpful and efficent. The person they were refering as a" Red Head "........ was very helpful and well mannered when we were there. The hotel is in one the most expensive area's in Paris. Hotels such as The Crillion, The Ritz to name a just a few, most are much more expensive then the Brighton. As for parking, hIring a car in Paris is not a good idea, it is much better to catch a cab, or to use the metro. All I can say is some people find fault with everything, and maybe their attitude has something to do with how other people react to them. I can honestly say a smile and good manners are a great help when travelling or for that matter in life, you only get what you give-out ......all in all the Brighton is a good choice with very spacious rooms, efficent staff and in a very good area. What more do you want for a wonderful stay in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, recommended”
Reviews.Author: LiveLondonWorkParis
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight Jan 30th 2007. Room 514, recommended, corridor in room and strange layout but good, low room in corridor (5,9ftish). Photos are taken with phone so limited quality Great location, very short walk to Tuilerie station and near gardens, Louvre and Faubourg St Honore and Grands Boulevards shopping districts. Clean and in good order throught. Pleasant and helpful staff. Nice room with possibly one of the best views in Paris (see photos). Bed comfortable. Room good size, I had the Deluxe Tuilerie room which is Tuilerie view (recommended) and slightly larger. Bathroom good and clean, only negative here is there was no wall mount for the shower head, seperate toilet. Has a feel of a nice modern apartment. Exposed beams in room (see photo), nice flatscreen TV. Cupboard by main door at end of corridor. Lots of drawers, limited hanging space. Room service is limited (sandwiches and the like). Value for money excellent and a very pleasant stay. I will be returning. Part of the Esprit de France group, booked on their website, also very good. Highly recommended, probably amongst the best value for money propositions in central Paris

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views and lovely staff. Get room 409!”
Reviews.Author: BrightTravelprincess
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Brighton last weekend and it was faultless. I had asked for a room with THE view and I wasn't disappointed. Francisco, who showed us to our room, explained all the sights out of the window and barring the Sacre Coeur, we had every Parisian landmark in our sights. The hotel is on a great shopping st, rue de Rivoli, which either takes you to Place de la Concorde, or it takes you into the Marais - a pleasure either way. The room (409) was huge with two windows and a small balcony to step out onto. The bathroom has both a bath and a shower and everything is clean. The hotel didn't mind 5 of our friends coming up for coffee on Sunday morning and to have a look at the view and also let us all leave our luggage there whilst we went to the flea markets. They have also very kindly forwarded my phone charger which I left behind and gave me a book from the bedroom which I offered to buy. The only minor complaint is that we were told that there is no Left Luggage at Gare de Nord which is incorrect and the receptionist on arrival was a little bit surly and pointedly, I felt, put away all his papers and cleared his desk before giving us any attention - minor, minor points given the rest! This place is FAB! Sorry I have photos and have tried and failed to load them...

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: irishnz
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We had a deluxe room to ensure the great view and it really was magnificent. To look out over the Tuilleries and to the Eiffel Tower was incredible, both day and night. The room wasn't that big but adequate. Nice flat screen TV, not many English channels but then too much to do in Paris to watch TV. The bathroom was a good size and well designed and sparkling clean. We caught the metro and the stop is just across the road, so very handy. If it is your first time in Paris I would really recommend the hop on/off bus; gives you a great overview of where everything is and how close things are. The hotel is positioned in a very posh area and it is fun to walk around the shops. We discovered a great wee restaurant a few streets away - Le Souffle at 36 rue du Mont - Thabor. Staff are friendly and food and traditional souffles are delicious, especially the sweet ones. Would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again in Paris, would book it immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: BitusEcho
Reviews.Content: Before booking our first trip to Paris I did my research to find the perfect hotel for our stay. Now, when you go to Paris for the first time, you hope to see the twinkle of the Eiffel Tower from your hotel room window, and I can confirm that the Hotel Brighton does not disappoint - absolutely magical! My husband and I stayed at Hotel Brighton in April 06. After reading a number of reviews prior to our visit I specifically requested room 511 (I have attached photos). Upon arrival we found a beautiful room, adequately sized (very French), and two small balconies that overlooked the Tuileries Garden and the Louvre to the left, and the Eiffel Tower to the right. We were very happy with the room, especially the view (despite the scaffolding which obstructed our view of the Eiffel Tower), and all aspects of the hotel. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Prior to arriving, I emailed the hotel to request they organise all our dinner and lunch reservations (i.e. Moulin Rouge, Jules Verne Restaurant, Bateaux Parisiens - the dinner cruise on the River Seine in a glass top boat; all the touristy things for first time visitors.). The staff were very helpful and easy to communicate with (considering I speak no French). They had no problems carrying out my requests and our reservations were perfect. My only complaint would be that the breakfast wasn't so great, however there are plenty of alternatives close by, and why wouldn't you want to try them all! Best points: 1. Great location - so central, we walked everywhere. 2. Fantastic views - I cannot believe how great the views were. Hopefully it won’t be too long until I’m back in Paris and I will definitely be staying at Hotel Brighton on my return. Look no further – book this one for a magical stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Best View in Paris ( Ifel tower, Tulleries, Panteon etc)”
Reviews.Author: JCMMexicoCity
Reviews.Content: This Hotel as recommended to us by a French Friend, and is one of the Hidden secrets in Paris. -The Best view in Paris. ( Trust me I Know Paris) -Tiny rooms with a good LCD TV. -Exelent Bathroom -Good Staff Service. ( It was rainning and we were offered an Umbrella) -Subway a few feet from the Hotel. -Great Value 155 € for ( Rue Rivoli), the two hotels a few steps ( Westin and other) are at least 350 €. -The only dislike is that the Hotel Public Computer did not worked for our stay so we could not cheked our mail. I really recomed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, shame about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: 15may06
Reviews.Content: We went on a romantic weekend to Paris. This was a so-so hotel. Great location being next to the Tuileries and a short walk away from the Louvre and the posh shops. The metro was also a stone's throw form the hotel. For a grand facade, the rooms disappoints. We paid for the upgraded room with a view and being on the 1st floor, all we could see was the treetops hence the view of the Tuileries were obscured! The rooms were quite basic however they were clean. It didn't give that luxury feel that was expected. On the bright side, the front desk staff were friendly and helpful (if approached!). Overall, great location, value for money was average in Paris I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ally101182
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for our honeymoon for 6 nights. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the Louvre and the Eiffel Tower. The views were amazing! The street below was loud but it was expected and did not bother us at all. The room was small but clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and clean also. The only thing we could find to complain about was the elevators. One is barely big enough for 2 people. The other one is even smaller. You cannot beat the location for the money! We had a great time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “would return”
Reviews.Author: nsff
Reviews.Content: Great Paris location, clean, would stay there again. Room smallish, but renovation well done so wasn't cramped. Room w/o view quiet, ones with view looked larger but lots of nois on main street facing Tuileries.

Reviews.Title: “Best View of Paris”
Reviews.Author: vivela
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 year old son, and I spent 5 wonderful nights at the Hotel Brighton in June 2006. The service was friendly. The breakfast was very good. The room was the biggest I have ever seen in a Paris hotel. We had a huge room with a pull out sofa and a king size bed. The bathroom was very spacious with a full bath and nice shower. The best part, we had 4 (mini) balconies with the most stunning views of Paris I have ever seen. We were right on top of the Tuileries and the Louvre. From our window we could see Notre Dame, the Orsay, Montparnasse, the Eiffel Tower, Place de la Concorde, and the Arc de Triomphe. The location was great too, especially if you are doing all the big tourist sites. We were right across the street from a metro station. Although the neighborhood is a bit ritzy, we found some charming little restaurants within a couple of blocks (Chez Flottes is a must)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Location”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia M
Reviews.Content: A friend and I had recently returned from a trip to London & paris. We spent 3 days at the Hotel Brighton and loved it!! Neither of us had been to Paris and this was as perfect hotel for first time visitors. We had a room with a view of the Tuileries Gardens. When we looked to our left we could see the Louvre and the view to the right was the Eiffel Tower. When the lights came on at night it was spectacular!!! You understood why Paris is called the City of Light. Bernard and his staff were extremely helpful. Benard's recommendations for restaurants in the area were wonderful. Our favorite was L'Imperial. It was a lovely bistro with terrific food and it was very reasonably priced. Our room was clean and tastefully decorated. The carpeting was rather worn in spots. There was some paint damage on the bathroom door. This somewhat distracting, but not enough to distract from the enjoyment of this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BradBourbon
Reviews.Content: What you would expect. Close to Louvre and Metro. Nothing wrong with this accomodation. Beware if you like to shower, not all/none of the rooms have one. Only baths.

Reviews.Title: “Bad view and small room”
Reviews.Author: Janeeda
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Paris and stayed in the Hotel Brighton, after reading the reviews on here we were shocked at the room we had been given. Our booking details stated that it was a superior twin room and when we got into the room it was a double bed. We were told that the room had been recently renovated and we could not disagree with that as everything looked very new. But the view from the window was awful out into a courtyard where it appeared that all the rubbish was dumped for the neighbourhood. On the second day we went down to breakfast to find that there was very little food, no plates to put food on and no clean tables. We asked for two coffees and after waiting 30 minutes we decided to give up and go to our room. I will not be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: erichschlaikjer
Reviews.Content: We booked this for a weekend dash by car to Paris. It is clean, friendly and central. There is underground parking nearby in the Place Vendôme. We had two triple rooms (210 and 213), in one of which we slept four, with cot. Both rooms had views of the Tuileries. Windows were double glazed to keep out sounds of the busy street below. Price was €255.00 each. We had a big flat-screen TV in 213. Bathroom was big and clean. Staff were friendly. Rooms on the opposite side of the hall seemed to be still under construction. Pretty touristy location but then...why are you in Paris? My only complaint was that the wireless was Meteor, which does not support BT OpenZone.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Views in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: andy/melanie123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated on thr Rue de Rivoli, which is one of the best locations in paris. The views from the rooms are exceptional and the hotel is much cheaper than its neighbours, the Westin, the Lotti and the very very plush Hotel Maurice (which is just a few doors down). Having looked at the other hotels, the Brighton has the BEST views. The rooms are very nice, with large beds, t.v, minibar / fridge, desk and chairs, balcony and the bathrooms have extra luxuries and most have both a bath and a shower. The cleaning is very good and the staff are excellent, especially Bernard, who went ot of his way to help us. You can never get tired of waking up and looking out on your balcony to see the beautiful Jardin de Tullieries in front of you, the louvre just to your left, the eifel tower (twinkling at night) ahead of you and the arc de triomphe to your right.. It is very central to most locations and whilst, the hotel does not have its own bar / restaurant, there are lots and lots to choose from along and behind the Rue de Rivoli, one of the best is the Rivoli Park Cafe, which is just 2 doors down! Plus if it did have its own bar / restaurant, it would become over priced like the others and then this little gem would be spoilt. We have stayed here 3 times and would not even look at another location for fear of missing the great views and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brighton Two Thumbs Way Up!”
Reviews.Author: Runner2006
Reviews.Content: I contacted Hotel Brighton after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and asked for a double jr suite with views of the Tuileries for our first trip to Paris. When we arrived I was absolutely thrilled with the room--I believe it was room 308. The room was an extremely large corner room (even by US standards) on the third floor with four small terraces (two facing the Tuileries with spectacular views of the Effiel Tower). The room had a nice sitting area and an extremely comfortable king bed. The bathroom was also quite large with a separate bathtub and shower and one wall of the bathroom featured large glass doors that opened to a small terrace off of the bathroom. The staff at the Brighton spoke English and were quite helpful to us. We were able to check into our room a bit early and were also able to check out late our last day. They also were quite useful with restaurant recommendations in the area. We enjoyed the Imperial (it is just down the street on Ru de Rivoli) as a great lunch place to sit on the terrace and watch people. We especially enjoyed the French onion soup--though while I would strongly recommend this place for a long leisurely lunch, I wouldn't recommend for breakfast (omlets weren't great and the entire breakfast was quite pricey at about 50 euro). We found the location of the hotel to be perfect for shopping in the area (many wonderful boutinques) and for walking to the Champs, Eiffel Tower, and Arc. We found a restaurant just past the Arc called La Grand Armee (on Ave De La Grand Armee) that we really enjoyed--a very large terrace that attracted Parisians rather than the tourist crowd. Food and service were exceptional. Assuming one of the jr suites is available when we travel in the future, we will always return to the Hotel Brighton when we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: cinlee
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in a junior suite last week and even though the running rate is EUR255(cheap even for Paris standard), we were charged EUR195 cos of slight broken window. The hotel is just renovated and everything is new and the hotel room has a very nice decor. Trileries Metro station is just across the road where you can get to everywhere and Lourve Musuem and Concorde is less than 50 m away. Rue St Honore is just behind the hotel. There are nice Japanese restaurant 2 blocks away which selll sashimi set for only 13 EUR, a great steal. Mcdonald is also nearby for the kids. I love the conceirge and even the porter, very nice and personable service. I will definitely spread the word that this is THE HOTEL to stay in Paris !

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved Hotel Brighton”
Reviews.Author: FLACHICK
Reviews.Content: My fiance' and I stayed at the Hotel Brighton from June 9th to June 14th and cannot say enough great things about it. We had a wonderful refurbished room (room 513) that had 2 small balconies, was bigger than the average french hotel room, had a stocked mini-bar/fridge, a desk, closets and had a very comfortable bed. The bathroom had marble countertops, a large tub/shower combo and was very clean (and was stocked with some great bath products). The decor of the room was very pretty. The view was simply amazing. It looked exactly like the pictures the previous reviewers had posted. When you looked out to your left you saw the Louvre, in front of you, Tuleries and Musee D'Orsay and to the right the Eiffel Tower (and everything in between). The staff was very helpful and friendly and helped us get reservations in restaurants. It's in such a great location that we walked everywhere. We did not get breakfast at the hotel (Why spend all that money for breakfast at the hotel when you can get a tasty croissant and cafe' for less than half the price at any of the neighborhood cafes). We will be telling all our friends and family about the Hotel Brighton and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was in an excellent location. We had a balcony which had a great view of some of the sites. The only downside was that there was no bar available in the hotel. However it is near a lot of bars and restuarants so it wasn't a big issue.

Reviews.Title: “A Paris Accomodation Secret!”
Reviews.Author: Drurolnz
Reviews.Content: This is truly a great location at a very reasonable price for Paris. Our room was recently rennovated (as I believe all of those available currently are) and had the "wow" view over the Tuilleries Gardens. The ongoing rennovation did not bother us and this should finish within the next few months. Hotel staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. The only negative was the traffic noise of the rue d' Rivoli, but you soon get used to this. I would head back to the Brighton next trip and recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for 2007”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we booked I made a point of asking if there would be any renovation work going on at the time of our stay. The reception staff said that there would be a little, but there would be no noise audible in our room. It was very disappointing to find that during the day a loud drilling noise which vibrated through the building could often be heard. Having stayed here several times before, the whole point of this hotel is the great rooms which provide an escape from the chaos outside. Until the work is complete we won't be returning, and even then it bothers me that they were less than honest when we booked. The work was due to end this summer (June 2006), but it now looks likely to continue for some months beyond that. Once the work is complete I would certainly recommend this hotel again, as I agree with most of the comments written below.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home Away from Home!!”
Reviews.Author: mspearl
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a wonderful trip to Paris. My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Brighton and we loved it. We stayed in 101. The room was renovated and VERY VERY clean. The bathroom was a nice size and there was a separate area for the toliet with a door. The room was cleaned everyday very well. I loved that it was sooo clean. Although the room was great, the view from our balcony was HORRIBLE, but it did not ruin our trip. We were not in the room that much anyway. Next time I will request on a room with a view of Tuileries Garden. The staff was excellent.Very kind and helpful. I truly appreciated all of there help. The area around the hotel is Great! Lots of shops and places to eat. Loved it! Metro: Tuileries is right across the street. I do recommend this place to everyone. Very charming hotel. Thank You Hotel Brighton!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value at the Brighton”
Reviews.Author: KnoxvilleCouples
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Brighton in mid-September for 3 nights, in a renovated room on the 4th (5th) floor, with a real balcony facing the Tuileries. The balcony was large enough for the two of us to stand on to look out at the Tuileries, the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower, the Musee d'Orsay, and even the Grand Palais (althought we didn't know what it was at the time). The cost was 165 Euros/night with breakfast an additional 8 Euros/person/day (we went to a patisserie down the street the first morning to "save" money, but there was essentially no savings and the continental breakfast at the Brighton so convenient. The hotel, on the Rue de Rivoli across the street from the Tuileries, is incredibly convenient - two blocks to the Louvre, across the Tuileries garden and the Seine from the Musee d'Orsay (and the RER station that took us to Versailles and the Batobus dock that took us up and down the Seine). Notre Dame and Ste. Chapelle were perhaps a 15 minute walk from us, Place de la Concorde maybe 10 minutes in the other direction. The staff were very friendly and helpful, although one should not expect a staff that is perfectly fluent in English. Walking up and down the Rue de Rivoli at night was a treat, and there are many very good (and affordable) restaurants in the area (notably the Au Dauphin on Rue de St. Honore).

Reviews.Title: “Return trip to the Hotel Brighton”
Reviews.Author: catsandroses
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my second stay at the Hotel Brighton and have been confused with some of it's neutral/negative reviews. This time I was with my mother and sister and we booked a triple room, expressly asking for a rennovated room overlooking the Louvre and Tuileries. We had two large windows opening to a large balcony and the views were some of the best in Paris, especially at 275E a night. The staff was very helpful, as they were during my last visit. They couldn't have been more friendly or helpful with directions, making phone calls for dinner reservations, etc. We usually opted to have breakfast elsewhere but the morning we did, the continental breakfast was fine and the coffee some of the best I had during my stay. There are now 2 elevators, the old, very tiny one and a new larger one. I still think it's fun to take the old one! The location right near the Place Vendome and across from the Tuileries Metro is unbeatable, we walked almost everywhere we needed to go and if not, jumped on the metro or the bus. I would definitely book this hotel again. Please note that it usually shows as "dates unavailable" if you check the internet travel sites so you may need to contact the hotel directly by email or phone which is what we did. The email I used was (-)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time here - room 411 with spectacular views over the Louvre, Jardin Tuileries and the Eiffel Tower. Every evening the Eiffel Tower has a light show on the hour and we sat on the balcony of our room watching it with a glass of wine and thought how lucky we are. We booked with the hotel directly on Esprit-de-France and got a special summer rate, staying 4 nights, paying for three, with breakfast included. It was excellent value, especially for such a perfect location. The room itself was well sized with a good bathroom, and well appointed. The breakfast room is gorgeous and the breakfast is perfectly French: croissants, pain au chocolat (divine), yoghurt, fruit, cheese, and coffee. In one of your reviews I read about the tiny elevator. Yes, there is one tiny elevator, but also one regular-sized just down the corridor. The staff were very helpful and gave excellent advice about local restaurants (any in the nearby Marche St Honore are very good). Overall, this is a perfect choice for a visit to Paris, especially if it is your first time and you want to be close to all the main sights. Pay the extra for a room with the Jardin Tuilerie view if you want the Oh la la factor.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: tnts
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with our experience here. We stayed in 511, which has the most unbelievable view. I doubt you can get a room with a view like anywhere for the price. While I understand that the place was somewhat rickety, our room had to be one of the newer ones, clean and well kept. Certainly not a luxury hotel, but we could've stayed on the balcony all night long. The view was practically a map of all the attractions in Paris. The staff was friendly and helpful with our cab early in the morning. The location is in a tourist area, but if you're looking to do the tourist things then it works wonderfully. If you want to hang with the locals then stay in another area entirely. We were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but pricey for what you get. Location only so so.”
Reviews.Author: joan1
Reviews.Content: We ( teenage son and I ) stayed 5 nights at this hotel this last August( 05) . The hotel is clean, with a lovely breakfast room( nice and sunny not a dungeon like some) and a lovely breakfast buffet. The room we stayed in ( room 511) was on the top floor and had incredible views, I mean probaly the best in Paris! Our room had two small balconies and we could see the Effiel Tower and the Lourve lit up at night. The bathroom was large and clean, but the tub had only a hand held shower, which we hate. The towels are clean but not nice , rough and stiff. The beds were comfy although sheets were never changed in 5 nights, I know this as there was a stain that never left! The air conditioning only works if you leave one of your key cards in the room inserted into a electric power slot, so if you need to take both keys out during the day you will return to a warm room, and the air cond . takes awhile to cool down room. Most of the staff were very nice , Bernard at the front desk was extremely helpful answering our constant questions. Most spoke enough english to be very helpful. The waiters spoke little english but were prompt and kind. The elevator was large enough for 4 people, two with luggage. Went right to the top. There is a smaller elevator that only goes to the 4 th floor. Our room was a renovated room, they are still in process of modernization so check when you book to see if you have a " new" room. We decided that the main flaw of this hotel was its location. There are no cheap places to eat around there, ( except a Mc Ds) and the Latin Qartier is a 20 minute walk, which we did after two nights of poor dinners that cost too much!The steet ( Rue du Rivoli) is lined with tacky tourist type stores( how many Effiel tower key chains can one buy?) , and althought the Lourve is right across street, we only went there twice so was it worth staying right across from it? Not to us. We will stay in the 5 th next time, we had started our trip with 2 nights in a budget type hotel there( Hotel des Mines) , and really liked it. We just think that although the Hotel Brighton was nice it just wasn't worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the Brighton!!!”
Reviews.Author: Manda B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and my family, stayed in the Brighton Hotel after reading all the fantastic reviews on tripadvisor.com. I can honestly say I am baffled by this hotels high scores and glowing reviews. We stayed there for 5 nights and were extremely upset arriving at this dump of a hotel. Lift was tiny and totally out of the way. We walked down three long corridors to get to our room (on the other side of the hotel), all of which had the carpet literally peeling away with boards exposed, which felt like walking through an old haunted mansion the boards wobbled so much. We thought we were going to fall through to the level below! The staff, apart from one man (I assume was the boss) were pathetic. Especially at night. One red headed man was so rude and useless we were furious with him the entire time we were there. I've never come across a less helpful and totally rude receptionist. He was useless. The location was handy, but not good. VERY noisy. Don't stay here if you have a car. We were told by the useless receptionist there was parking just around the corner - we ended up parking about 4 blocks away. I could go on with the examples. The whole stay was just awful. Over all I would most definitely NOT recommend this hotel. It was the worst one I have stayed in in all of Europe. Unless they have gutted it it should have been pulled down long ago (and my families room was just as bad, so it wasn't only our floor or our room). If you're happy to use the public transport in Paris (which is easy) then I would stay at Les J'ardins D'Eiffel (unsure of spelling). I stayed there a few years ago. It's a lovely hotel, lovely staff (who also speak English and are handy with directions and suggestions), view of Eiffel Tower from the breakfast room and some bedrooms and delicious breakfasts, great splendid location down a little Parisian alley way a short walk from the Seine and Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: DesAlpes
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hotel Brighton for four nights in June and we'll definitely be back. We had a renovated room, but a friend of ours was there at the same time and had an older room but was perfectly happy with it, too. Although breakfast is available in the hotel I can't imagine why one would have that instead of getting out into the streets of Paris. There is a cafe next door on the corner where we had coffee and croissants every morning and watched Paris go by on the street and sidewalks. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I can't remember any names but every single member bent over backwards to help us and they were very patient with my broken French. My companions spoke no French, but that wasn't a problem. Regarding the small elevator. We used the tiny one quite a bit and found it quite cute. But don't think that's all there is. There's a bigger one that will hold several people and their luggage just a few feet away. While the neighborhood isn't the most charming in Paris (nothing wrong with it, just no much charm) it IS very conveniently located. We were within walking distance of so many places, but with the Tuileries Metro station, on the #1 line, just across the street, we could quickly and easily get to anyplace we wanted to go. And Paris Vision is only about four doors down so if you are inclined to do anything with them it is quite convenient. We'll be stopping in Paris for a few days next year at the beginning of a month-long stay in France and I'm pretty sure we'll be staying at the Brighton.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it a lot, once we got a good room!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first room was on the mezzanine level (level E), just above the reception. When we entered the room stank of air freshener. It looked out onto the very busy street UNDER the arches outside , so it was very dark and had NO view. And it needed double windows to keep out the traffic noise - we like to sleep with a window open, but this would have been impossible. Having established we were not having a "moment" we went down to reception armed with our email requesting a quiet room. Within 5 minutes, we had been reallocated to a renovated room overlooking the courtyard - the room was large, well lit and well ventilated - in fact it seemed like a room of a higher standard. We were very pleased but wondered why we had been assigned to the noisy and dark room initially - maybe because we were two men travelling together. I suggest you confirm that you are getting a quiet room at the back OR a noisy room at the front of the hotel with a view and avoid the mezzanine level. Incidentally, the hotel has the tiniest lift we have ever been in - kinda cute.

Reviews.Title: “Smartest thing we've done”
Reviews.Author: fellowtravelersmhl
Reviews.Content: The street-view rooms have the best views in Paris!! Out our 3rd floor (309) room we gazed at the Eiffel Tower as it flashed lights each night. We also overlooked the Louvre, just accross the street. There is street noise, but we didn't care. The room was huge, made by combining two original rooms. The bath was bigger than our home's, with both a tub and a walk-in shower. It appeared to be recently remodelled. If you are staying in Paris--do yourself a favor and book the Brighton. It's rates are less than many competitors located on side streets.
